campaign.story:
HOME STRETCH! MASSIVE UPDATE & BONUS! YOU DID IT! FULL GAME IS UNLOCKED FOR ALL! We want to get you the best game possible so for the final push: ALL BACKERS GET ALL PLANNED (& unannounced) REWARDS if we reach $30,000!  UNLOCKED!!
This means EVERYONE gets:
Upgraded to the full core game of 80 Invention Cards!
Upgraded core game to include 300 Hilarious Pitch Prompt Cards!
With Massive Gratitude - Stacy  
WHAT THE WHAT?! is a 3-10 person party game where players compete to invent outrageous new uses for genuine old time inventions.
Featuring audacious attempts, fantastic fails and clever contraptions from the world's patent archives.
There are Self Saluting Hats, Rocking Chair Bathtubs, Flying Machines and a few that would likely kill you.
Researchers from the Smithsonian and White House Historical Association have spent hours curating 100 inventions from circa 1581 to today. 
We brought this game to Kickstarter because its curious community rises up to support the bold, outlandish creators today. We believe many of you would have backed these incredible inventions.
Whether it was a lack of access to funding, cultural constraints or an inability to share their message widely, the majority of these inventions, never got past the patent or prototype stage. With your help we can now bring them to life!
Our beautifully illustrated Digital Booklet deep dives into the journey and motivations of some of the Inventors who, in our opinion, didn't fail, but inspire us with their try. 
More exciting Stretch Goals planned! Become a backer to help unlock! 
To unlock voting for which Illustration Card makes it to the final deck go to each social channel and follow us!  Once we hit our goals voting begins!

campaign.story:
MiniQuest Adventures is a Dungeon Crawler book game for 1 to 4 players in the purest 16 bit video game.
Each match will generate a random dungeon that the player must overcome in order to reach and defeat the final boss.
The Heroes will receive rewards such as weapons or equipment that will help them face off against enemies, which will have increased stats in each successfully completed round.
Take a look at the content included in the Adventurer Pledge!
Help us reach these goals and receive exclusive campaign extras!
Each goal accomplished will reveal the next Stretch Goal!

Dive into the world of MiniQuest Adventures!
Taking inspiration from other genre big-shots, we have reinvented and simplified the mechanics to create a direct, fun and challenging game for youth and adults.

How many rounds will you be able to overcome?
A different adventure on each occasion!
Thanks to the randomness of the game, each match will be different from the last, making the game very exciting.
Different enemies await the Heroes on the insides of the dungeon.
The players will be able to combine items and abilities to perform truly deadly attacks.
The basic box of the game includes instructions printed in English, German and Spanish.
French will also be included thanks of our great community!
Portuguese and Italian will be available digitally from our website.

You can take a look at the FAQ section to read the manuals.
Game Play
The players decide which kind of game they want to play.
The players choose their Heroes and place their starting equipment on the character sheets alongside their Health, Power and Defense points.
The youngest player gets the Leader token and reveals the first room.
The cards are placed in the turn queue, switching between Heroes and Enemies.
The enemy tokens are placed left to right and from top to bottom.
Health and Defense markers are placed on the enemies.
The turn begins with the player that has the Leader token.
The character performs their actions.
In case an enemy is defeated, its token is removed and when the combat is over we discard its card.
On the enemy turn, we will check their AI to perform their actions.
We will repeat the process until the encounter is resolved or the four Heroes fall unconscious.
Loot cards are received.
In case of being a final room, the players will also receive epic loot.
If the players decide to play more than one round, they unlock their Skill and will reveal a Threat card to increase the enemies stats.
Spells
Certain items allow additional Spells to be equipped.
Spells are placed on top of these items. In case of them not being active, they must be carried in the Item Bag taking up one space.
The player that uses more than one spell must choose which one to use when their action is performed.
Skills
Before performing any action, the player must decide whether to use or not the Skill.
The Skill, just like Spells, will cost Power and the player will benefit from its stats when attacking.
Elite and Boss Skills
The deck corresponding to the enemy is prepared.
A card is revealed each turn of the enemy and that card’s action is performed.
If the Skill persists through various turns, the card is put aside, placing Time markers each turn of the enemy until the effect disappears.

campaign.story:
Canvas: Reflections is an expansion to the critically acclaimed transparent card layering game, Canvas. 
In Canvas you layer transparent cards to create paintings. It is both a puzzling strategy game and a one-of-a-kind artistic experience. The expansion, Canvas: Reflections adds millions of unique combinations with its double-sided transparent cards.
Store it on your shelf or hang it on your wall!
Reversible Mirror Cards. Each card can be flipped to reverse the position of the icons. The artwork on each side has a different color scheme.
New game board. Players choose from 2 rows of Art Cards. This gives you a selection of 8 options, including a choice of 2 free Art Cards (for added flexibility when you're short on Inspiration Tokens).
Gold Bonus Ribbons. Grab a Gold Bonus Ribbon worth 3 points for lining up a specific Element next to a Gold Bonus icon.
8 New Scoring Cards for puzzling new challenges, intriguing new scoring synergies, and more replayability.
Signature Styles (Deluxe edition only). Each player begins the game with a different Signature Style. Score 2 points for each illustration of the shown type in one of your completed paintings.
Wood Tokens (Deluxe edition only). 16 screen-printed wood Ribbons with shiny metallic gold paint, plus 10 screen-printed wood Inspiration Tokens.
Ribbon Pins (Deluxe edition only). The player with the most points and the player with the best painting are awarded the Best In Show and Masterpiece ribbons.
 DELUXE EDITIONS | The Deluxe editions of Canvas and Canvas: Reflections will not be available in retail.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Canvas: Reflections will be printed on high quality, durable components. The sleeves that come with the game are not only essential for gameplay, they also help increase the lifespan of the cards. Canvas was designed with expansions in mind, so that Canvas: Reflections and future expansions will not require unnecessary duplicate printing of base game components.
Reusability and recyclability
Our manufacturer, PandaGM, will produce replacement components so that damaged or missing pieces can be replaced with a small shipment instead of a second copy of the game, saving gas and materials. Canvas components are stored in reusable storage bags. The box efficiently holds all game pieces and add-ons without wasted space from a plastic insert.
Sustainable materials
The box and punchboard are made from 30% recycled materials for the ideal blend of durability and sustainability. The cards are made with materials from FSC certified sources. Components are printed with eco-friendly water-based ink and varnish. Our premium components are made from wood instead of plastic. The packing cartons are 100% recycled paper pulp.
Environmentally friendly factories
PandaGM recycles all plastic and paper waste. The factory is fully air-conditioned for worker comfort and has passed ISO worker health and safety standards, is BSCI social compliance certified, and follows the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety. Their project management and customer service teams all work remotely, which has a major impact on their carbon footprint.

New critters and new ideas are arriving every day at the Newleaf train station! Being the first official city of Everdell, Newleaf has grown into a thriving destination with numerous exciting opportunities to discover and explore. Attract eager visitors to your city, make your reservations, travel further with tickets, and build the most prosperous city Everdell has ever seen! Prepare to experience an all-new Everdell that will keep delighting and surprising you for many more seasons to come.
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Lurking in the depths of Mistwood, the cunning and villainous Nightweave plots to take over Everdell with the aid of her spiderlings. Pit your wits against Nightweave and her sticky schemes in both solo and two-player games, and recruit heroes of yore from our More Legends and Corrin Evertail expansion packs as well as transform your farms with our new Through Every Season expansion pack!

Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Dive tailfirst into the world of Everdell with the Complete Collection. Build a city of critters and constructions and explore the Emerald Valley and beyond; celebrate the Bellfaire, wonder at Newleaf’s mechanical marvels, trek into the Spirecrest Mountains, explore the underwater depths of Pearlbrook, and chance the dangers of Mistwood. Play against automated opponents including the dastardly Rugwort and cunning Nightweave, meet heroes of renown in our Legends II and Corrin Evertail expansion packs, and find abundance in new farms in our Through Every Season expansion pack. Everdell is easy to learn, yet offers satisfying strategic depth and endless replayability.

Will the sun shine brightest on your city?
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.

New to Everdell?
Check out this great How to Play video from Watch it Played!
Within the charming valley of Everdell, beneath the boughs of towering trees, among meandering streams and mossy hollows, a civilization of forest critters is thriving and expanding... Everdell is a game of dynamic tableau building and worker placement played over four seasons. Whoever makes the most impressive city wins! 

On your turn, you can take one of three actions:
a) Place a Meeple: You have a collection of wooden Critter meeples. You can place these on the board locations, events, and on Destination cards. Critter meeples allow you to perform various actions to develop your city: gathering resources, drawing cards, and taking other special actions.
b) Play a Card: Each player is building and populating a city; a tableau of up to 15 Construction and Critter cards. There are five types of cards: Travelers, Production, Destination, Governance, and Prosperity. Cards generate resources (twigs, resin, pebbles, and berries), grant abilities, and ultimately score points. The interactions of the cards reveal numerous strategies and a near infinite variety of working cities.
c) Prepare for the next Season: Critter meeples are returned to your supply and you gain bonuses depending on the season. The game is played from one year’s winter through to the end of autumn. Players add up the points from their cards and other bonuses and whoever has the highest total wins!
New content that will delight and surprise you for many more seasons to come!
Golden Occupied Tokens
The new Critter and Construction cards in Newleaf are played like normal Critter and Construction cards from the base game, except that you use Golden Occupied tokens instead of normal occupied tokens. These Golden Occupied tokens are limited -- a player can never use more than 3 in a game! These new cards are very powerful, so choose wisely which you'll spend your Golden Occupied tokens on! 

Through Every Season Cards
Since the beginning of Everdell’s history, farming has been a vital part of the valley’s way of life. Farmers face a number of challenges through the four distinct seasons of the year and must adapt as the weather changes. Experience the story of an Everdell farm throughout the year!
The 8 new special Farm cards in Mistwood replace the basic Farms in your Everdell game. These often give you the choice of two abilities, and you choose which of these abilities to use each time the card activates.

More Legends
Legendary cards represent unique Critters and Constructions that are powerful upgrades of other Critters and Constructions. Use them when you are familiar with the base game, and are looking forward to a twist on a regular game! The More Legends cards in Mistwood are added into a game of Everdell in the same manner as the Legends from Everdell: Collector's Edition.
New ideas are arriving every day!
Station Cards
Faceup Critter and Construction cards on the Station board work like Meadow cards and may be played on your turn, but whenever you play a card from the Station, also gain the reward listed on the Train Car tile beside the card! This reward is gained after you have fully resolved the played card and any additional cards that may have activated as a result. After you've gained the reward, replenish both the Train Car tile and the card played.
Remember: cards on the Station board are not Meadow cards, and therefore any abilities that affect Meadow cards (such as the Inn) do not apply to Station cards!

Visitors
Newleaf is a bustling and growing city in Everdell, and now that the railway system is in full operation, many new critters and big ideas are coming into the Emerald Valley. The Visitor cards that come into play on the Station Board offer players a new end game scoring opportunity!
To gain a Visitor card on your turn:
Place a worker on the Station. The Station is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Choose 1 of the faceup Visitor cards and discard it facedown on the Visitor discard pile.
Reveal 1 new Visitor card and choose 1 of the 2 faceup Visitor cards to take and place by your city. If you do not want either of the faceup Visitors, you may draw 1 from the top of the Visitor deck instead. If you selected one of the faceup Visitors, replace its card with another one from the Visitor deck.
Gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles by the Station; set that tile aside and draw a replacement tile.
Visitor cards will score their listed point values, if your city contains their requirements at the end of the game. Visitor cards that you have obtained and failed to please (by not meeting their requirements) are not worth any points at the end of the game.

The Knoll
You may place a worker on the Knoll to choose any 3 cards from the Meadow and/or the Station to discard. Replenish the discarded cards from the main deck, and draw any 3 cards into your hand from the Meadow and/or the Station. After drawing your cards, you may then gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles. Set that Train Car tile aside and draw a replacement tile from the bag. Finally, replenish the 3 cards you drew into your hand.
The Knoll is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Everdell has a brand new villainess!
Now while playing Everdell, you can pit your wits against Nightweave, our newest automated player for solitaire and two-player games. Nightweave is designed to function like a real player at your table: she has her own hand of cards, Prepares for Seasons on her own schedule, and, most importantly, she has her own agenda!

Nightweave has her own Big Critter meeple along with 8 spider meeples (not just 6!) that will move about the board to do her bidding -- blocking exclusive Locations, taking events away before you can get them, and even enacting Plots and Plans that will interfere with your options as a player, reminiscent of the Weather cards from Spirecrest.  She has eight different personalities that influence what she targets and focuses on, so there's lots of variety in gameplay!

What Happens on Nightweave's Turn?
Turn over the top card of Nightweave's Activity deck. These cards are the heart of her decision-making during the game, instructing her to play cards into her city, place spider meeples on previous, exclusive Locations, take a Basic or Special event, etc.
Nightweave will perform the first action listed for her current season, if possible. If she cannot perform this action for any reason, she will take the second action for her current season. If she cannot take that action either, she will perform as much of the Default action at the bottom of the card as she can. This could include discarding cards, collecting point tokens (yes, really!), and/or a number of other actions.
If Nightweave herself is in the Meadow and there are no spiderlings left in her lair when she draws an Activity card with a Spider or Nightweave icon, she will Prepare for Season. 
The game ends when you run out of actions and when Nightwave Prepares for Season at the end of Autumn.

Can you stop Nightweave from taking over Everdell? Check out the Rulebook for more in-depth information about this automated player!

campaign.story:
The Red Dragon Inn is an award-winning series of games in which players play as colorful adventurers (well, mostly adventurers) who are drinking, gambling and roughhousing to celebrate their latest dungeoneering exploits.

If you're new to The Red Dragon Inn, welcome! The Red Dragon Inn 8 is a standalone expansion that contains everything you need to play! Just pledge for the Kickstarter Edition (or, if you're feeling swaggy, the Collector's Edition) and you too can join the ranks of Red Dragon Inn fans around the world!

Farai is a high-ranking cleric of the Great Temple, but his first love is brewing. His brewery and tasting room, The Harmonious Cup, is a part of the Great Temple and not only brews the sacramental wine, but also helps pay for the temple's many charitable works!
Samantha runs The Scurvy Dog, a feisty tavern down by the docks. Fights break out there so frequently that Samantha decided to start taking bets on their results. Her quick wits and business savvy have turned her "low class" establishment into a bustling destination!
Lucky owns a "booze cart" that travels around town selling spirits and avoiding trouble with the city guard. She sources her alcohol in various... "creative" ways. Whenever some ale is approaching its expiration date, Lucky is there. Whenever a barrel of Dwarven Firewater falls off the back of a warehouse, Lucky is there. Whenever a local thief needs an item fenced, Lucky is there. (But that's the part of her business she doesn't want you to know about!)
A highly skilled barista and baker, Phyll runs Startusk's, a coffee shop just across from the main entrance to the Mages' Collegium. Many Greyporters thought that it would be folly to open a shop that only serves snacks, high-end drinks and potions, but the line out the door every morning proves those naysayers wrong.
Nerodia is the clever and devious proprietor of The Black Dragon Depths, the tavern catering to the baddies and their henchfolk. She's a drink-serving, staff-managing, business-running dynamo with boundless energy and eyes in the back of her head - literally. If you're nice to her and the staff, they'll serve you drinks. If you're not, you may find yourself taking a one-way trip to their statuary hall.

RDI 8 includes the Pub Crawl Variant, which may be played with any characters (not just the ones in RDI 8). When playing with the Pub Crawl Variant, the party travels around to other taverns, sampling new and interesting drinks, and doesn't return to The Red Dragon Inn until they've had everything those other taverns have to offer!

If you'd like to try the game, it's available right now on Tabletop Simulator! (Tabletop Simulator is an online boardgaming platform available on Steam.)

And if you're looking for like-minded SlugFans to game with, then sign up to join our Discord Playtest Group! There you'll find folks interested in games like The Red Dragon Inn, and Battle for Greyport, and Dungeon Decorators, and you'll also be part of the group that gets sneak peeks at future SlugFest products!

For more detail on the molded plastic miniature, please see our update about that!

Post-campaign pledge management for this campaign will be handled by BackerKit. After the successful funding of the campaign, you will be able to use BackerKit to manage your order and pay shipping costs. If you live in the US, Canada, Europe (EU or not), Australia or New Zealand, you will also have access to our add-on store, which will include the Red Dragon Inn series, plus Battle for Greyport and its Pirates expansion, plus Dungeon Decorators.
And if you don't want to wait for the end of the campaign, and you want our other products right away, you can just buy them now on our website!

We will provide customs-friendly shipping to the US, Canada, the European Union, the UK, Australia, New Zealand and China.
We encourage all backers to read our Kickstarter policies to ensure that there are no surprises when it comes to shipping and other matters.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We pride ourselves in our ability to deliver a quality product on time, and we stand by our track record of doing so. We know how to run a Kickstarter project, and when there are problems, we fix them. However, here's a list of things you should know that could possibly go wrong:

1. Development Delay: Development on this project is nearly done! The only delays that could come here are a) if we notice something really bad in final playtest that we didn't see before, or b) one of our artists gets hit by a bus or something.

2. Manufacturing Delay: We have a great relationship with our manufacturers and they work hard to get us our stuff on schedule. However, as always, unforeseen problems can arise, such as global pandemics. 2020 gave us even more insight into the various things that can go wrong here, so we're facing 2021 even stronger than before.

3. Shipping Delay: Once games are manufactured, they need to be shipped from China to regional fulfillment partners, then from those fulfillment partners to you. Things can sometimes go very wrong in that seemingly-simple process. True story: an entire shipping container of our games was stolen back in July of 2012. Seriously.

4. Customs Delay: We have no control over the border policies of any country we import games into (including the US). Sometimes games get held up at a border - sometimes for a bafflingly long time.

5. Alien Invasion Delay: Extraterrestrials could invade and enslave us to their will, and they may not be tabletop gamers.

The good news is that this is not our first rodeo by a LONG shot. We have launched and delivered on multiple campaigns to the satisfaction of our backers. We have padded our promised delivery date with all of the realistic delays in mind so you can confidently expect your game to arrive by our stated delivery date.

updates.update_content:
Hi again, folks. Later today, we'll be charging cards in BackerKit. If you haven't logged in to BackerKit yet to fill out your survey, now would be an excellent time to do so! If you haven't received any notification AT ALL yet from BackerKit related to this project, it means that something along the way is getting spam-filtered. Contact us at support@slugfestgames.com to get that sorted out.
So, what happens when we charge cards? Well, for most of you, BackerKit will simply charge your credit card for the amount of the difference between your Kickstarter pledge and your total order (which includes shipping and add-ons, plus ).

Hi, backers! Here's the latest on RDI 8!
TL;DR: The BackerKit add-on store will close on June 7, and credit cards will be charged for shipping and add-ons on July 1. Manufacturing is underway, but we are not yet estimating a delivery date, since ocean freight is still highly unpredictable.
Want more details? Read on!
Manufacturing: The manufacturing process has begun, and we have been told to expect color proofs sometime this week. These proofs give us one last chance to make sure that everything looks right and to fix any last-minute typos we find. And last week, we got this kick-butt prototype:

Hi again, backers, and thanks for your patience while we got the last details in order. We'd like to apologize again for the delay in getting the pledge manager and the add-on store open, and we'd like to reiterate that the delay in hitting this milestone has NOT impacted development on the actual game. In fact, the art is done, playtesting is done, and the print files are currently being proofread by multiple pairs of eyeballs.
So, why the delay in the pledge manager? Well, we were making sure that we got the metal Coins of the World right before presenting them to you. Our friends at Campaign Coins created several different prototypes for the two-tone elf coins. Although the technology allowed several different options for making them two-tone, none of those options did justice to the fine detail of the design itself. As a result, we decided to make those elf coins a single color of metal with shading.

Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore. 
Here's a look at everything included in a base pledge: 
This image is updated with unlocked stretch goals.
28mm scale Factory Sample Photo (not final color).
Miniatures painted for example purposes only. Miniatures in the game will come unpainted.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss.
Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path.  Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over 2 ACTS: the Dungeon and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss!
In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect Legendary Loot, and Supreme Spells. 
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect. 
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact.
The story is yours to tell in...
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Dungeons, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe, Potions & Perils, components shown below.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!
Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players! 
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore. 
The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!
In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins! 
The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dungeons to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
CoraQuest began life on a particularly boring lockdown afternoon. Cora, my eight-year-old daughter, and I both agreed that we were fed up of doing the same old maths worksheets. We decided we wanted to do something more exciting with our time instead - like design our own board game!  
Cora and I spent many enjoyable days working side by side on our game. Cora was having so much fun she never noticed me sneaking school work like maths, creative writing, art and computing into the project (shhh, don't tell her). As CoraQuest developed we both felt so pleased with it that we wanted to share it with other people too.
While it started as a homemade project, CoraQuest has had massive amounts of support from a whole legion of playtesters. Although its roots are still true to the game Cora and I made together on our kitchen table, our playtesters have helped us develop CoraQuest from its rough and ready origins to a smooth-running, polished, and above all very fun game.
There's enough content in the CoraQuest box to keep you going for a very very long time. However, Cora and I had so much fun with the creative process of making the game that we wanted to provide the same exciting experience to others too. 


The rulebook for CoraQuest includes guidance and encouragement on how to create and draw your own heroes, characters and adventures - making the game fully customisable.  
What's more, we've even made a fantastic free web-based app that you can use to create your own heroes and print them out on "official" cards and matching standees. Just draw and upload your picture, choose your hero's stats and special abilities, and then print them out - it's as easy as that!
CoraQuest is designed to be as accessible to children as possible without diluting any of the fun for adults. Here are three of the key features of the game:
You explore the dungeon by drawing cards from the dungeon deck and placing each card out into the layout.  This means every game you play will have its own unique dungeon map - providing a different experience each time. 
Whenever you venture into the dungeon there is a chance you will encounter some of the fearsome creatures that lurk there. Orcs, goblins and gremlins emerge from the shadows whenever a card with their symbol is added to the dungeon.  
Whimsical and family-friendly narrative emerges during the game via the "quest cards" that are spaced out within the dungeon deck.  When a quest card is placed in the dungeon you read a short passage from the quest book and carry out any special instructions it gives you.   
The quest cards' illustrations include multiple elements that are open to interpretation, allowing you to use them as inspiration to design your own adventures.
Combat is exciting, fun, and simple for even young children to understand. It's resolved using custom red and white dice. Your hero card and your weapon tell you what colour dice you need to roll, then you inflict one damage to your target for each success you get.  
If you're in combat and you completely miss your target your hero flips over to their "determined" side. This means you will get even more dice to roll for your next attack. This helps take the sting out of rolling badly for younger children (and for adults too).
The countdown track adds another level of decision making and tactical thinking to the game.

Each hero has a special ability that is activated by putting a token on the countdown track. At the end of each round the tokens will move down one space on the track. You're unable to use your special ability again until your token has moved off the bottom of the track and has come back to you, so you need to think very carefully about when is the best time to use it. 
The countdown track also has a second use - to add the threat of a spider attack! 
This mechanism has received some of the highest praise from our playtesters, as it creates tension and ensures the game moves along at an exciting pace.
Each time you complete a round without having explored further into the dungeon, the "threat token" moves down one space on the countdown track. If it ever moves off the bottom of the track then a swarm of spiders appear in the dungeon and start attacking the heroes. The ever-present threat of being swarmed by spiders really moves the action along! 
Sharing creativity and fun is at the very heart of CoraQuest, and that is why we not only encourage you to make your own content for the game, but we also encourage you to share it with others too! 

We have a special section on our website where we host community-created adventures, heroes and enemies that people can download and use for free. We already have lots of things on there. For example, acclaimed board game designer Jerry Hawthorne (Mice and Mystics, Stuffed Fables) stumbled across the print and play version of CoraQuest and liked the idea so much that he sent us this awesome band of brave rodent adventurers that he designed and drew.
Jerry's characters will not be included in the CoraQuest box, but they can be downloaded to print and play from the CoraQuest website.

Jerry isn't the only one who has sent in their work for us to share on the website though! Look at these fantastic adventurers from six-year-old Enydd Chadwick.
Be aware that these are the prototype versions of the game. They do not feature the finished artwork and there may also be some small changes made to the rules before final production.
Why should I back CoraQuest on Kickstarter?
If CoraQuest doesn't get funded on Kickstarter it won't ever be made. This is very much a passion project for all involved and we do not have the resources to make and distribute the game without your support.
Will CoraQuest be available at retail?
We don't have any plans at this time to put CoraQuest into retail distribution, however if the opportunity arises we would consider it.  
If the Kickstarter doesn't reach its target will I still be charged?
No. You will only be charged if we reach our target.
When will I get my game?
We are aiming to deliver the game in late November 2021. We will keep all the backers regularly updated on each stage of the process until everyone gets their games.
How long after the campaign ends will you be charging for postage? 
We will be sending out an email via our pledge manager (Gamefound) around two to three months after the campaign has ended. This is so we can minimise the risk of us charging either too much or too little for postage, as the rates for this can fluctuate.
Will I have to pay customs charges or tax on my game?
We will absorb the costs of customs charges and taxes (including VAT) for games delivered to the US, Canada, UK, Australia, New Zealand and the EU so you should not have to pay any additional fees in these areas. Other regions may have additional customs charges as per local regulations.
How thick are the Dungeon Cards?

Risks and challenges
THINGS CAN CHANGE 
All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change. Rules are subject to change. 

As the game has not been manufactured yet, all images and descriptions are what we are aiming to create. It is possible during the production process that some items might change in appearance, functionality, size, or quantity. We will attempt to keep such changes to a minimum. 

FULFILLMENT 
Bezier Games, Inc. has been publishing boardgames for more than 10 years. Several factors can cause delays that are beyond our control, including manufacturing issues and shipping delays. The COVID-19 pandemic could be a factor in possible delays; in all cases, we've tried to incorporate a reasonable level of padding into shipping estimates. 

The estimated fulfillment is December 2021, but keep in mind that this is just an estimate, this year more than ever before. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. 

RESTRICTED DELIVERY 
Due to increased frequency in Kickstarters failing to deliver to certain locations, Bezier Games, Inc. has decreased the amount of locations Kickstarter rewards may ship to. This is because of several reasons - the majority being issues of reward packages getting lost, stolen, being unable to clear customs. In addition to this, some countries have been removed due to heavily increased accounts of piracy. 

Bezier Games, Inc. will only be shipping to the following locations: United States of America, Puerto Rico, Canada, United Kingdom, Europe (European Union, Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Georgia, Iceland, Kosovo, Liechtenstein, Macao, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Norway, San Marino, Serbia, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, Vatican City), Australia, New Zealand, China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea, Taiwan, Philippines, and Military (APO)

SHIPPING
Shipping is charged after the KS campaign concludes, based on the actual costs Bezier Games incurs to ship from distribution centers to your delivery address. All shipping & handling costs will be paid by backers through our BackerKit Pledge Manager. Links to this pledge manager will be sent roughly two weeks after the campaign ends. The BackerKit pledge manager is a 3rd party used to finalize orders and shipping outside of Kickstarter, Kickstarter has no responsibility in this regard. Shipping costs vary based on where you will have your reward delivered; we always do our very best to ensure backers the best price possible. 

At the start of this campaign, we expect the box included with the Collector level and Royal level to be about 300 x 300 x 160mm (similar to the Suburbia Collector’s Edition “regular” box) and weigh about 11 pounds. The Colossal level includes the same box, PLUS an additional box which we expect to be about 300 x 300 x 148mm, shipped together in a single carton weighing about 26 pounds. The shipping estimates below reflect these calculations.
 
Regional applicable taxes will be calculated in the Pledge Manager as well. Our shipping is US, CA, EU, UK, AU friendly meaning rewards will ship from within these regions. Any VAT for EU and UK will be collected in the pledge manager.

REFUNDS 
Bezier Games, Inc. will do whatever they can to minimize the risks but, should a backer become uphappy, we are willing to refund pledges if issues should arise while the Pledge Manager is open. Refunds of 100% of collected funds are available within the first 14 days of a campaign's end. Past that, Kickstarter still needs to collect their portion of the pledge which we do not cover. This results in a 90% refund given if it is requested after the 14 day period. Once the Pledge Manager closes, refund requests will be reviewed on a case by case basis. 

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. Bezier Games, Inc. is not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange. 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS 
By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels will not be tolerated. Bezier Games, Inc. reserves the right to cancel any pledge. 

If we ship to the address that you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is returned to us as undeliverable you may be required to pay the full cost to ship your reward again to a revised address. 

If we ship your reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package tracking status shows as delivered to that address, but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again, you may be required to pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address in addition to the amount of the original reward including any add-ons and other upgrades on your order. 

If we ship the reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is held in customs or by any other government agency, our ability to help may be limited. You may be required to contact your customs agency or government and arrange for the package to be cleared and released at your expense. We are not responsible for any fees levied against your pledge by customs or any government agency. We are not responsible for any refunds or re-shipments for packages held by customs or a government agency. 

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason Bezier Games, Inc. will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order. 

If you do not log in to our Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. Bezier Games, Inc. reserves the right to deny or fulfill orders beyond these 8 weeks under our discretion. If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our Pledge Manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. 

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the retail release. 

If you have questions or concerns about these terms & conditions please email orders@beziergames.com for further information. Thank you!

Tabletop Tycoon will donate a game to Toys for Tots for each game sold through this campaign. To date, we’ve raised enough as a company to donate over 60,000 games to kids. This campaign will help give even more! 
The Newest Expansion to Nemo's War is Here! Featuring...
 A COMPREHENSIVE OPERATIONS MANUAL & BETWEEN VOYAGES GUIDE: The new Operations Manual shows how to run the ship turn-by-turn and includes many useful appendices at the end, while the new Between Voyages Guide features instruction for setup, ending the game, scoring, epilogues, variants, and more!

 A NEW 2-PLAYER VERSUS VARIANT: Joining the riveting solo and cooperative modes where players command the Nautilus, in this game variant one player will play as the Imperialists, bent on its defeat. Includes special cards and 2 Imperial Squadron Miniatures!  

 A NEW CHARACTER TILE: Entering our story is Nemo’s son, Nadeen Dakkar, who crosses paths with his father after hearing news of mysterious events at sea!

 NEW FINALE CARDS: Spice up your endings with The Trap, Imperialists’ Catspaw, Scientific Espionage, and The Kraken! 

 NEW STERN MOTIVES, ADDITIONAL NAUTILUS UPGRADES, AND EVEN MORE TOKENS & MARKERS! 
Brave the hazards of the seas, combat vessels around the globe, incite uprisings, chronicle amazing wonders, find mysterious treasures -- your quest knows no bounds in this Ultimate Edition. Combining all expansion content, including the Journey’s End Expansion, both new and returning players will be able to experience everything Nemo’s War has to offer. Play solitaire, cooperatively, or competitively; the choice is yours!

Each turn, you must address the seas’ challenges in a grand adventure, confront the growing pressure of the Imperialist powers’ navies, undertake Actions with the Nautilus and her crew – all while maintaining Captain Nemo’s spirit to continue.  The Turn Sequence is as follows:

Begin each turn in the Event Phase by flipping an event, Test, or other card from the Adventure Deck. Favorably resolving Tests, and using resources to manipulate your die rolls in this pursuit, will be critical to securing a victory no matter what your motive is.
Roll high, captains, but be careful: your mission ends in Defeat if you deplete a Ship Resource. Developing an understanding of the probabilities, risks, and rewards for each Test and to what degree will ultimately be the reason for your mission’s success or failure.
Next is the Placement Phase, where you roll the dice for this round’s Oceans for Ship token placement based on the game’s current Act and your Notoriety. Strategic choices about where to place your ships, what we call “painting the board,” will be crucial to your plans! Which Oceans to populate (and, through combat, denude) is the vital strategic chess game you are playing with the Imperialist powers who oppose you.
 You also receive the Differential Roll result of the two (selected) white dice rolled in Action Points for that turn. If the two (selected) white dice are doubles, a Lull Turn takes place..
  Now it’s time to act! During the Action Phase, you spend your Action Points to Move, Attack, Search for Treasure, Incite Uprisings, and more, all to advance Nemo’s goals.
Always remember: you are questing for the greatest number of Victory Points (VPs) that you can acquire, as modified by Captain Nemo’s Motive, while avoiding the many ways to suffer defeat. BVPs are earned in several ways (e.g., sinking enemy ships, passing TEST Events, collecting Treasures, inciting oppressed peoples, making scientific discoveries, etc), so choose your actions wisely each turn, and beware: 
 Your mission ends in Defeat if your adventures gain too much notoriety, as you become an international Pariah to be hunted down mercilessly.

Repeat these Phases until the game ends with your early defeat or you reveal the Finalé card that ultimately instructs you: “The game ends!”

When all is said and done, read the epilogue to your voyage in the Between Voyages Guide. Your level of victory and motive will change the story of your Journey’s End.

Here's a Preview and How to Play video for The Ultimate Edition from the Game Boy Geek:
You can also check out this How to Play from Meeple University with designer & developer Alan Emrich! This video uses an older edition of the game, but it does an excellent job of showing the gameplay.

Newcomers, a warm welcome to the community of Escape the Dark players. Allow us to run you through the story so far...
The Game of Deep Space Adventure
The second game in the Escape the Dark series, Escape the Dark Sector is a simple, sci-fi adventure game for 1 to 4 players with a focus on atmosphere, storytelling and player cooperation. It takes just a few minutes to set up, lasts around 45 minutes, and each mission is randomly generated so no two games are ever the same.
Playing as the beleaguered crew of an impounded starship, players find themselves confined to the detention block of a vast space station. Using a variety of advanced gear and weaponry, they will embark on a desperate mission to find their ship and blast their way home.
Along the way, the crew will have to overcome a variety of dangers, traps, and terrors. From cyborg guards and faulty replicators to killer alien organisms, with each challenge represented by a large, lavishly illustrated chapter card.
As these immersive chapter cards are revealed one by one, the game takes on the form of a shared storybook experience, with the players making decisions about what to do each chapter before using a combination of tactical dice combat and timely use of item cards to complete them.
The goal of the game is to recover your starship by completing every chapter in the mission deck and defeating the final boss. To win, you must keep each member of the crew alive - if any player is killed the game ends immediately.

campaign.story:
The tile-matching hit from 2018 is now back with a revised rulebook and a new expansion, Finesse!
In this Kickstarter, you can pledge for a copy of the second printing of Project L, including a new revised rulebook, a new Finesse expansion, as well as the content from the original Kickstarter campaign.
Project L is a fast-paced engine building strategy game for 1-5 players. This perfect family game is packed with choices that will keep your brain running at full steam.
The core of the game lies in completing puzzles with pieces. Completed puzzles give you points as well as extra pieces to use. The more pieces you have, the more difficult (and valuable!) puzzles you may try to complete.
You start the game with just two little pieces, and on your turn, you can do three actions (you may do the same action repeatedly):
Take a new puzzle
Get a new small piece or upgrade a piece that you have
Place a piece on your puzzle
Master action (only once every round) — put a piece on all your puzzles!
Optimize your actions so that your engine grows rather than runs out of steam. Quick development is crucial since once players have taken all the valuable (black) puzzles, the game ends and the player with the most points wins. 
With the Finesse expansion, you can complete goals on Finesse tiles to earn Credits. You can then spend the Credits to do extra actions.
The Ghost Piece expansion adds 24 new puzzles with unique shapes and new reward mechanics. There are also 3 new types of level-5 pieces, the Ghost Pieces. This expansion enhances the replayability of Project L and opens new strategic options for you to explore.





How to get the Add-ons? To get the add-ons, click on the Manage your pledge button. Then, click on Change your pledge and increase your pledge amount by the total cost of the add-ons you want. You will be able to select the add-ons you have pledged for in the pledge manager when the campaign ends.

The Boardcubator Ambassador Program is our way of thanking all the wonderful people in our community who stayed with us throughout the campaigns and whose support and help keep us moving forward. It’s because of your continuous involvement and interest in our games that we amass enough energy and motivation to push our projects further ahead. As a thank you, we’re including a special promo pack in all our Kickstarter campaigns that our ambassadors get for free!
You will automatically receive Project L: Finesse Ambassador Pack for free if:
You have pledged during the first 72 hours of the campaign,
You have supported any of our previous Kickstarter campaigns, or
You were subscribed to our newsletter before this Kickstarter campaign launched.

  Looking back to the original campaign in 2018, Project L went a long way. Two years ago, thanks to the support of all the amazing backers, we've fully unlocked all Stretch Goals that allowed us to produce the game in a shape and quality we had never dreamed of. There's not much that could be added or upgraded — just look at what the backers and reviewers say!
When it comes to the Finesse expansion, we had no other option than to follow the quality of Project L & Ghost Piece (not that we wouldn't like that), so Finesse is already coming to Kickstarter in a super-maximized mode.
We prefer to not add anything superficial, untested, or not fitting the content that's been originally planned for the game. And since mostly everything has been already added to the game, the inevitable result is that this campaign is Stretch Goal free.
On the other hand, the journey towards making Project L a reality has been so exciting that we just love the idea of sharing it with you in full detail (in even more detail than that the backers of the original campaign remember!). To accomplish that, we’ve prepared a series of behind-the-scenes stories as well as making-of interviews.
Stay tuned for the project updates!
Since the original campaign from 2018, we’ve partnered with Paul Grogan from Gaming Rules!, a professional rulebook writer & editor, to enhance and streamline the way you can learn to play Project L. Furthermore, focusing on the feedback we’ve received since the first version of the game, we’ve also perfected the rules in terms of game mechanics—mostly concerning the player actions and endgame. 
Check out the Revised Rules 2.0 (WIP).
Printed Revised Rulebook (2.0):
 comes automatically with all pledge levels! So, if you're a backer of the original campaign and are now pledging for the Returning Backer rewards (just the Finesse expansion), you'll receive the physical revised rulebook 2.0 as well.
includes the rules of Project L (base game) and all expansions in a single book.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Project L went through multiple iterations of technological design and solutions to make sure all components are very durable and will last through many plays. Rulebooks, game boxes, player aids, and puzzle boards have scratch resistant varnish or lamination that ensures that these components will last a long time under frequent use. Based on hundreds of rounds of playtesting, we have gradually improved the technological aspect of puzzle boards into their current 5-layer structure.

The base game is readily expandable without the need to make any component changes or upgrades to the base game that would require releasing a new version of the game. All expansions of the game can be mixed together.
Reusability and recyclability
Given the durability and material quality of the components in the game, Project L will last a long time before it starts showing signs of use or general material deterioration. In the rare case a component gets damaged, we will provide replacement parts.
Sustainable materials
Project L holds Verification of Conformity according to the EU Toy Safety Directive 2009/48/EC, which declares the game as safe for children and parents to play with and also verifies that there are no physical / mechanical, flammability, or chemical risks.
Environmentally friendly factories
Panda GM, the manufacturer of Project L pays extreme attention to worker comfort and safety standards with a fully air-conditioned environment, while being BSCI social compliance certified and following the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety.
Sustainable Distribution
Based on our previous experience with successfully fulfilling Kickstarter projects, we are constantly optimizing the shipping routes to make sure that the distance the game travels is as short as possible. We use several distribution hubs and fulfillment companies to make sure that packages are shipped in bulk where possible before the last mile delivery to our backers. All international shipments are realized through sea shipping, which is more environmentally friendly than air shipping.

campaign.story:
Voir la page du projet en français.
The 7th Citadel is an all-new cooperative exploration and adventure game from the creators of The 7th Continent.
In this post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy world, you play as a “slave-gardener” who escapes from the Citadel of Necrodruid Ninidazir’, only to find yourself confronted by an even greater Threat!
Explore the Collapsing Lands freely by gradually unveiling the board using numbered terrain and event cards. Interact with your environment and converse with its inhabitants.
As the scenarios unfold, your choices, for better or worse, will lead you inexorably to the epic finale against the Threat!
The 7th Citadel carries over the best aspects of The 7th Continent: huge territory to explore, hidden numbers to spot, botany, etc.
However, many changes make it a brand new game:
an original post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy universe to discover,
survival (crafting, hunting, "die & retry") is no longer the heart of the game,
customize your personal Action Deck, choosing the skills you want to make your character unique,
interact with the many inhabitants of these lands thanks to a dynamic dialogue system,
expand your influence on the Collapsing Lands by updating the world map,
return to your Citadel between scenarios...
…where you are building a city that will signal the renewal of this desolate world!
We’ll be sharing more about these new features throughout the campaign in our updates. Support us now and join our quest to restore The Collapsing Lands to their former glory!
"The 7th Citadel is an absolute sublime adventure. It takes the exploration that I enjoy so much about The 7th Continent while refining its gameplay by streamlining the mechanics in a way that’s both fresh and entertaining. Adventure gaming at its best!” Jeremy Salinas – Man VS Meeple
"If 7th Continent was the journey, then 7th Citadel is the destination. This is a great evolution of the game mechanics. Returning and new solo players are really going to enjoy the extra layers of depth!” Adam Smith – Rolling Solo
"Overall the game is very, very sharp… really compelling whenever you run into somebody to talk to. This is some of the best conversation with board game characters [NPCs] I’ve ever had!" Richard Ham – Rahdo Runs Through
For the last seventy years, the Kel Protectorate has been at war with a fearsome enemy: the Burrowers. Controlled by a mysterious individual, these elongated worms tirelessly dig underground tunnels, causing swathes of territory to sink into the bowels of the earth. 
After years of helplessness, the Protectorate finally found a defense against this scourge in the Necrodruids – men and women who rejected the sacred principles of the Druidic Order to draw upon blood and forbidden incantations. The Necrodruids used their blood rituals to create monstrous plant-creatures capable of combating the Burrowers.
In the Citadels, the Necrodruids’ power centers, YOU grow and tend to the abominations developed within, whose seeds are then spread all over the world to protect the territory against the Burrowers. Working as a slave-gardener, you wish that a fatal accident or death by exhaustion would relieve you of your endless toil.
The world has clearly changed since the days of your forefathers. The Collapsing Lands are choked in gloom and dust belched up by the Burrowers. The horrific plant-creatures that were created to protect you have spread, sometimes out of control, and are now just as much of a threat to humanity as the Burrowers.
On a cold morning bathed in pale light, you awaken for another long day of hard labor in the sacred grove, unaware that this will be your last day at the Citadel and that the course of history is about to change...

Solo or cooperative game for up to 4 players.
30 seconds to set up the game, 30 seconds to save it!
1000+ minutes of thrilling adventure per Threat.
Relive the sensation of the adventure books where you are the hero!
No die rolls: the more energy you spend, the more you increase your chances of success, but the faster you burn out!
Live a different adventure every time; there are countless surprises and the game remembers your choices!
Earn new skills, unlock bonuses, construct buildings: your decisions determine your path. Choose your destiny!
In The 7th Citadel, you face a Threat which will inevitably come down on you (unless you perish before you get there!).
Each Threat comes in the form of a booklet with several scenarios that follow one another, until the final scenario where you either win the game or succumb to the Threat.
Unlike most board games, you will experience an adventure over time, but rest assured, a simple save system allows you to pause your game at any time to resume it later.
You are a slave-gardener, captive of The 7th Citadel for several years now.
You start the game by choosing one of the available characters. Each character has an optional quest and a personal Action Deck.
Casek, female (front) and male (back) version of a playable character
Casek's personal quest
As your adventure progresses, you will choose new skills to create the character YOU want to play. Far from the usual archetypes of warrior, mage, and healer, you will have the freedom to develop your character as you choose.
Are you more into Cunning or Arcana?
Whether you want to play a teenage arcane master with a slingshot, an eloquent adventurer who can sneak through the shadows, or an elderly swordsman who summons creatures to assist him in battle, the choice is yours!
You progress in the adventure by exploring the Collapsing Lands (the game board, made up of numbered cards).
Here you undertake actions that usually result in taking numbered cards from the Adventure Deck to progress through the adventure. These are usually terrain cards or permanent events that will progressively form the game board, but also include obstacles and challenges to overcome, equipment, companions, and side quests.
The game is full of random events, always consistent with where you are, and many alternative cards to experience a different adventure every time you play.
Pay attention to the details and observe your environment carefully: it contains a lot of hidden information and numbers that will be very useful to you!
Each turn, you collectively decide which character will take the next action (search, fight, move, speak, and more) from those available to them (on the terrain card where their miniature is, their character card, an event, one of their skills, etc.).
There are more than 30 actions that you can perform!
All actions have a cost (the minimum number of cards to draw from your Action Deck), a difficulty (the number of successes you must obtain) and consequences that vary depending on whether the action succeeds or fails. 
An action is resolved in four steps: Preparation (choice of objects, companions, etc.), Draw, Result and Consequence.
Over the course of the adventure, taking actions will gradually deplete your Action Deck. When you run out of cards in the Action Deck, you must perform a Recovery to replenish it by reshuffling the cards from your Discard, but you will then lose 5 life points.
When you are almost out of life points, or when you've reached your scenario goal, it's time to return to the Citadel!
The Threat Booklet will detail the consequences of your actions, which will vary according to your choices and performance, and take you to a new scenario.
The Collapsing Lands is populated with dozens of non-player characters (NPCs). 
You will be able to converse with these NPCs using the “Book of Dialogues”, which is divided into nonlinear numbered paragraphs. You will not only choose what your character says, but also the tone they use. Then you will find out what happens by reading the indicated paragraph number.
A chapter from the Book of Dialogues
The Collapsing Lands is also a hostile world where you'll have to battle strange creatures in tactical encounters that take place over several rounds. 
These compound actions are identified by the presence of a die, whose value indicates the difficulty of the round and decreases as you gain successes. The encounter ends when the die is removed from the card, usually after you have successfully completed the last round of battle.
If you want to get out unscathed, you'll need to equip yourself with weapons, armor, and spells, and you’ll need to seek out companions. That won’t be enough to truly face down the Threat, however! You must also develop your skills and your Citadel, and that's where your Destiny comes in.
During your adventures you will gain Hope through your feats of arms and the completion of side quests.
You can spend it to acquire new skills, build buildings, send emissaries to map the Collapsing Lands, and much more. There are so many possibilities that you'll have to choose the direction YOU want to go in!
Buildings will grant you powerful effects once built such as allowing you to start each scenario with more life points, items, or companions. They will also increase the characteristics (defense, knowledge, production…) of your fellowship, in order to defeat the Threat.
You start the game with a map of the Kel Protectorate. This world map provides valuable information about places of interest – city-states, garrisons, waterways, etc. – in the world as it was before the war started. Unfortunately, things have changed a lot since then. 
You will be able to send emissaries to map the Collapsing Lands to update your world map by inserting numbered cards into the plastic sleeves provided for this purpose. You'll be able to obtain interesting effects,  and might even gain the ability to start future scenarios from a more advantageous position, closer to your target destination!
The Collapsing Lands are aptly named. Every step you take could see the ground open up like a gaping maw, eager to swallow you whole. But what if there were a hidden world below, filled with secrets and treasures just waiting to be discovered?
“On the Edge of Peril” is an exclusive expansion offered in the Collector's Edition pledge. It includes 2 dividers, 30 cards, 1 rule sheet.
It expands your adventures with new Exploration cards that will hinder your progress until you fight off the danger.
During your adventure, you may be instructed (no spoilers 😉) to slip the “Peril” divider behind the 110 card. Whenever you take a Terrain card stored after that divider (card nr. 111 and up), you must replace 1 Exploration card attached to that terrain with one showing the “Peril” (skull) icon.
Luckily, you possess a Groundquaker, a powerful artifact stolen from the Necrodruids, which will help you push the divider further back and with it the edge of peril!
We’ve been working on The 7th Citadel for over a year now.
The game’s mechanics have been heavily tested over the last few months. Dozens of players have had the opportunity to try them out, notably at the Essen 2019 and FIJ (Cannes) 2020 trade fairs. Their feedback has enabled us to come up with this almost final version of the rules.
Nevertheless, this "beta" version of the rules is likely to change slightly between now and delivery.

Founded in 2010, Serious Poulp was all about seeing the games we designed come to life.
We’re two friends that love playing and making games. Also, one of us is pretty handy with a pencil.
We’ve been working together for almost 20 years, in the digital communication agency we created in 2002, then as Serious Poulp, which we founded in 2010, when the temptation to publish games became too strong to resist.
Role-playing games and gamebooks played a significant part in both our childhoods. Bruno was 5 when “The Warlock of Firetop Mountain” was published. Ludovic was 11 and already had a few prototypes on the go (one of which would eventually become The 7th Continent!).
We've been inspired by many great works during our lives, whether from board games, role-playing games or video games. When we started out in the board gaming industry, we naturally brought all of these elements with us.
We are not only the designers of the games Serious Poulp publishes: Ludovic also creates all of the illustrations and visual elements for our games and Bruno, apart from writing cards and rulebooks, supervises production.
In 2019, we were honored by the Spiel Des Jahres (kritikerpreis) award for the cooperative party game “Just One” we designed, published by Repos Production.
Bree has worked on Kickstarter campaigns in a variety of roles, from marketing and communications support to community management, a role which she is delighted to be handling for The 7th Citadel campaign. She lives in Las Vegas, NV with her two cats, Samus and Remy. Many of her favorite games are deck-builders or abstract strategy games, but she will play just about anything.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
TRACK RECORD

The 7th Citadel is our third Kickstarter campaign. To date, we have delivered rewards to over 60,000 backers around the world.

We have accumulated experience and selected our partners (manufacturer, logistics, distribution centers) among the best in the world, so we are confident in our ability to deliver this project and ensure its follow-up (communication with the community, after-sales service) with the same professionalism that we have shown so far.

The main risk factor, which can never be excluded given the complexity of such a project and the potential number of backers, lies in a possible delay in delivery.

COMMITMENTS

Because you place your trust in us and allow us, through your support, to bring our project to life, we are keen to clarify our commitments to you.

To this end, we commit ourselves, as we have always done, to:

1. not launch a new Kickstarter campaign until we have delivered the previous one.
2. do everything possible to guarantee the sustainability of our company through sound management: control of its workforce, its operating costs and investments.
3. ensure continuity as far as possible in the event of force majeure
4. keep you informed with regular updates about the project until its delivery.

We would like to thank all our backers for the trust and support they have shown us since 2015!

REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked.
If the refund is requested more than 15 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 15% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Kickstarter.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

All payments (pledged on Kickstarter and/or in the pledge manager) will be made in €uros. Any costs shown in $ will be based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign (1$ = €0.85), the levy of your pledges and the pledge manager will be entirely in €uros.

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that you are responsible for providing correct address information, and ensuring that this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret that we are unable to ship to PO Boxes in most countries. If you do not reside in a shipping friendly zone , you agree that you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities.

If you cannot accept these conditions, we advise that you do not back this project.

Each weekday during the campaign, we will be revealing a fabulous new "stretch goal" upgrade that will be added to the finished Kickstarter product. Check back frequently to see what will be included in your pledge! Here's what we have so far!!
OUR FINAL STRETCH GOAL HAS BEEN POSTED BELOW - THANKS FOR EVERYONE'S INPUT AND SUGGESTIONS!!
Lizard Wizard is an action-selection game. Every turn will be filled with delicious tension, as you decide which of six possible actions you will use to increase your power.
Check out these game previews to learn more about the game!
“Everything about this game oozes charm, joy and happiness.” “Lizard Wizard hit an incredible sweet spot for us with an incredibly fast playing game, with gorgeous production, a great bit to noodle about in a great overall package.” - Rahdo
“Lizard Wizard is a ton of fun! This potentially could be my favorite game that I’ve played so far this year.”– Bethany (Ryan and Bethany Board Game Reviews)
"Anyone who enjoyed Raccoon Tycoon is going to absolutely LOVE Lizard Wizard. More strategies; more depth; more amazing artwork from Annie Stegg. Pure Magic!" - Mark Streed (Dice Tower)
"Lizard Wizard has a combination of familiar mechanisms that work together really well, with low down time between turns, and different ways of winning the game. Not to mention the stunning artworks. It's a very well designed game, satisfying to play." – Meeple University
"Lizard Wizard art really draws you in.” “There’s good replayability in the game if you like resource management, market fluctuation and a little bit of press your luck.” – Kevin Delp, Tantrum House
“It’s rare that a game that plays this well also happens to look this good, and that’s a testament to the attention that Forbidden puts into their products.” – Nicholas Leeman (GLHF Board Games)
"A perfect mix of mechanics and theme, Lizard Wizards was a joy to play."  "Dripping with theme, Lizard Wizard is the perfect blend of amazing art and solid mechanics." - Jimmy Hudson, Board Game Closet
"I’m constantly itching to play Lizard Wizard again. And again. And again. And after that? Again, I’m sure." "Playing the game is an experience in losing yourself in the moment. All I knew that existed was the game and those I played with." - Benjamin Kocher (Board Game Immersion) Lizard Wizard Story and Preview on Board Game Immersion
"I highly suggest Lizard Wizard and intend to add it permanently to my collection." - Mackenzie Hoffman (The Meeple Street) Lizard Wizard Review on The Meeple Street website 
"If you have played Raccoon Tycoon, you are definitely going to enjoy this game as the next step up in gameplay, strategy and fun!" – Isaac B. Villa (Gaming With Sidekicks) Lizard Wizard Preview on Gaming With Sidekicks
“Lizard Wizard serves as a solid meeting point for fans of casual games and those looking for something a bit heftier.” – Naomi Laeuchli (Casual Game Revolution) Lizard Wizard Preview on Casual Game Revolution website

Annie Stegg Gerard has a special love for the 18th century Rococo painters who have had a large influence on her own method. She finds inspiration in their imagination, and the dreamlike palette and lively brushwork that combine to create a wonderful atmosphere of enchantment. She believes that they sought to transport us to different worlds and fantastic places though their works. In her own work, known for its beautiful, enigmatic figures and lively creatures, Annie strives to depict this same transportive effect to the viewer. Her work is an exploration of the small hidden worlds that exist in our own backyards and the drama that unfolds with their unseen inhabitants. The secrets that are waiting to be discovered, and the mystery in a hidden moment of time. Annie exhibits her work in galleries and has done notable publishing work for clients such as Disney, Hasbro, Wizards of the Coast, Easton press, Netflix and more. Her work is found in private collections all over the world.
