GAME DESIGNER AND PUBLISHER
Glenn Drover was the founder and president of Eagle Games, Inc. from 2000 – 2006. During that time he ran the company while also designing and publishing several premium board games, including Railroad Tycoon, Age of Mythology, Conquest of the Empire 2, Sid Meier’s Civilization, Attack!, and others. In 2007 under his private Tropical Games label, Glenn also designed and published Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery, which enjoyed great commercial and critical success.
Glenn is currently President of Forbidden Games and has designed and published Victory and Glory: Napoleon, Railroad Rivals, Raccoon Tycoon, Extraordinary Adventures: Pirates, Dungeon Party, and now: Lizard Wizard.
GRAPHICS
Jacoby O'Connor is a freelance graphic designer living in the far western suburbs of Chicago. He first started working on boardgame projects 20 years ago while working at a small agency where his first project was Glenn Drover’s American Civil War, followed by War! Age of Imperialism, Railroad Tycoon, Age of Mythology, Conquest of the Empire 2, Sid Meier’s Civilization, Attack!, Napoleon in Europe, and others. Since then he has been the graphic designer on many other titles such as North Star Games' hits Wits & Wagers, Say Anything, and Evolution. He is now the designer for all things Forbidden Games including Raccoon Tycoon, Extraordinary Adventures: Pirates!, and Dungeon Party!
PROJECT LEAD
Sean Brown has worked in the game industry for over 15 years, half of them for Eagle Games as a salesmen, co-designer, graphic artist, marketing director, developer, and warehouse manager (many at the same time) and half of them for Mr. B. Games as the President. He has worked on Alien Uprising, Spurs, Realm of Heroes, Zothren Invasion, Posthuman, Days of Ire, Madness at Midnight, WarQuest, Liars Dice, Prospectus, Helionox, Hellenica, Panic, Aviation Tycoon, and Clockwork Kingdom as a designer, developer and/or graphic artist for Mr. B. Games as well as the following titles via graphic art, development or co-design work while at Eagle Games: Age of Steam, Age of Empires III, Attack Deluxe, Baltimore and Ohio, Brass, Defenders of the Realm and all of its expansions, Defenders Battlefields, Empires Builder Expansion, I'm the Boss TCG, Incan Gold, New England Railways, Pirate Dice, Railways of the World and all of its expansions, Roll through the Ages, Through the Ages, Tumblin' Dice, and Wizards Brew.

Helping to make Lizard Wizard a reality with your support

Take command of an able crew and set a course for adventure in Dead Reckoning. Explore mysterious islands, fight battles, upgrade your ship & crew, and build  fortifications to protect your holdings. The player with the most treasure in their chest when the game ends wins!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Backers who pledge at least $5 during the campaign will have access to the Pledge Manager and will be able to make a Late Pledge with the same terms, conditions & pricing as Kickstarter Rewards.

All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are approximate and are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change and is not finalized. Rules are subject to change.

Alderac Entertainment Group has been in the publishing business for more than 20 years. We are experienced at producing games in China and distributing them worldwide. Nonetheless there are always risks associated with manufacturing and logistics.

These problems can delay or otherwise impact our ability to meet our commitments to our backers.

These issues include (but are not limited to):

* Production delays
* Shipping delays
* Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is May 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize these risks as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

Before the rewards are shipped we offer no questions asked refunds. Once we have shipped your reward our refund policy will depend on the circumstances and will be at our discretion.

At your request we can give you a full refund within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that we will subtract Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from Kickstarter after 14 days). Those fees usually equal 10% of the total pledge.

Refunds will be processed through Kickstarter and will be applied to whatever payment method you provided to Kickstarter. In the event that is impossible we will work with you to arrange a refund through other channels.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. AEG is not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels for the project will result in the cancellation of your pledge (with a full refund) and your ejection from the campaign. We want the communications channels for this campaign to be a friendly, positive place for our community to gather and discuss the campaign, ask questions, and provide input.

AEG reserves the right to cancel any pledge (with a full refund) at any time, for any reason.

Minor cosmetic damage to the box or other packaging can occur during shipping. AEG makes reasonable efforts to ensure that the shipping containers it uses are suitable for the safe delivery of your rewards. If you believe that your reward has suffered more than minor cosmetic damage please contact us immediately. Keep all packaging including outer cartons for our inspection. AEG will at its sole discretion determine if the damage constitutes other than minor cosmetic damage and/or was the result of insufficient packaging.

If we ship to the address that you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is returned to us as undeliverable you will pay the full cost to ship your reward again to a revised address.

If we ship your reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is delivered to that address but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again, you will pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address plus the amount of the original reward including any add-ons and other upgrades on your order.

If we ship the reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is held in customs or by any other government agency, our ability to help may be limited. You may be required to contact your customs agency or government and arrange for the package to be cleared and released at your expense. We are not responsible for refunds or re-shipments for packages held by customs or a government agency.

In all cases you acknowledge that quantities are limited and AEG may not be able to ship all or part of your order more than once.

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason AEG will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order.

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in to our Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your reward if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our Pledge Manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

If you have questions or concerns about these terms & conditions please email kickstarter@alderac.com for further information.

updates.update_userinfo: Printed Proofs Approved and a Heads Up!
updates.update_content: We hit an important milestone recently when we approved the English language printed proofs! French and German proofs will have to go out-of-house for approval, so that runs later. Normally, I'd want to share images to show you what a big job this is (and it is a HUGE job), but the Saga content is designed to be "discovered through play" so Mark wouldn't let me share the massive piles of paper he had to look over. But he did take these shots and said I could share them. The important part is that this represents another milestone down!

I’ve been holding off on making this post until I have definitive shipping information to tell you. Unfortunately I don’t have definitive information for you, but it is clear that we won’t be hitting our target shipping month. So I pulled together all the data I could from all of AEG to get you the best possible information I could. I wish I could tell you exactly when you are going to get your game, but that’s just not the state of things right now.

However, if we cannot be clear about exact times, we can at least be completely honest about where we are and what we think the process will be as of right now.

Short update today...
The Pledge Manager is closing in 2 weeks (the 31st). After that point, we will no longer be accepting late pledges. In addition, normally you can "add an extra copy" during the pledge manager if you were already a backer, that will also likely be turned off or limited at that time (we'll be sure to leave a copy for each backer). Why are we doing this?...

I got a ping asking for an update, which I’m always happy to do. So here is where things are as of now…

We are (fingers crossed) within days of finalizing all the files. The complexity of this project, particularly with all three languages, has definitely caused some late nights by the team and we’re all going to breathe a sigh of relief when these files get to the printer.

Holidays over. 
First week of "Oh man, we are so far behind from taking those days off" is over. 
Time for an update!!

Just a quick update...
Things are moving along. Translation are just about wrapped up, which is a bigger milestone than you might think, especially for such a big game. 

One of the great things about doing translated versions in-house is that the translators often catch small issues that we may have missed in the English version - nothing huge, just corner-cases that we may want to cover more fully or places where extra clarification might be a good idea.

Felt like it's been awhile since I've done an update, so I thought I'd fire one off. I honestly never know how often to do updates - I back a lot of Kickstarters and I could do with a few less TBH, so I'll keep this short.

Dead Reckoning is working it's way through the pre-production process now. There is a lot of tranlsation-related work going on as everything (cards, rules, books, sagas, etc...) has to be translated into German and French and then laid out as well. It is a TON of work, but it's getting done.

updates.update_content:
Tldr; We're on a boat! Pledge manager closing in one week. If needed, update your address on CrowdOx.

Fellow cosmonauts, 

We are so thrilled to announce, the wait is almost over. Intrepid is no longer sitting in the docks, we were finally able to secure spaces on boats and delivery is in motion again! All locations are ready for blast off.

TL;DR - Production is complete. Currently awaiting space on a container ship, hopefully later this month.
Fellow Cosmonauts,
I've said it before, and I'll no doubt say it again - life in low-earth orbit can be rather dicey. Only a few weeks ago, NASA and the Canadian Space Agency discovered the station's Canadarm2 had been struck by orbiting debris, ripping a hole through the arm's insulation. CSA referred to the hit as a "lucky strike", as neither the robotic arm nor the astronauts aboard the station were harmed.

TL;DR - Production is wrapping up, currently waiting for an opening in overseas freight.
Fellow Cosmonauts,
It's been a busy few weeks for the International Space Station. A historic crewmember made his way safely home, China launched their first entry into the space-station race, and NASA admitted to a complete lack of space-unicorns (so far). But despite all that going on, what I want to talk about is variety.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
While the current state of the International Space Station is common knowledge, we speak about its construction much less frequently. What started as left-over parts for the Mir space station, the ISS eventually expanded to become the largest object ever put in space - and the most expensive (and complex) object ever constructed. So it's no surprise that the construction of the station was riddled with problems. Funding cuts, shifting geopolitical climates, engineering setbacks - these were all just part of the job. In the end, it took thousands of engineers on earth and hundreds of astronauts in space to complete the station, equipped with everything from robotic cranes and NASA-designed space-bolts to run-of-the-mill hacksaws and duct tape.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
As much as the theme of Intrepid focuses on the potential disasters aboard the International Space Station, a typical day on the ISS is much more mundane. When not eating and exercising, astronauts generally fill their day with routine maintenance - replacing filters, repairing equipment, storing cargo. While not terribly exciting, these tasks are what keeps the station running smoothly. According to Colonel Terry Virts (commander of Expedition 43 aboard the ISS), life on the station is 99% calm and routine.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
We're only a few weeks into the new year and already, significant events are taking place. As part of the first spacewalk of the year, astronauts aboard the ISS worked to finalize the installation of Bartolomeo, a new, European science facility. Bartolomeo was delivered last Spring and has been slowly working through the installation process. This spacewalk was supposed to be the final step, but a couple of faulty power cables forced the astronauts to abort. Of the six cables needed, two would not fully attach to the facility. And while Bartolomeo is fully capable of running with only four power cables connected, the astronauts decided it was better to wait until everything was perfect before moving forward.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
Let me be among the first to wish you a happy new year. 2020 was a real challenge for so many people all over the world - including astronauts aboard the ISS, who have dealt with aging technology, space debris, air leaks, and even COVID-19 restrictions. Just like us, the ISS crew had reason to celebrate the beginning of 2021. Since they couldn't use a ball drop to count down the end of the year (nothing really drops in micro-gravity), the astronauts did the next best thing and released a ball upwards into the station.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
Earlier this month the world celebrated the 20th anniversary of continuous human life aboard the International Space Station. Since its original launch, the station has undergone massive renovations - what started as a single module (the Zarya) has expanded to a sprawling network of science laboratories, life-support systems, storage platforms, and living quarters.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
It takes a lot to become an astronaut. You must be in peak physical condition (NASA's long-duration flight physical exam is no joke). You must have a master's degree in a STEM field. You must have a minimum of two years of professional experience in a related occupation. Something tells me my years working on this game probably wouldn't count.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
I don't think it would be overstating things to say 2020 has been a crazy year. Sometimes it can be tempting to look up at the stars and dream of an easier life off the planet. But just a quick glance at recent headlines and you realize, just maybe, you've got it a bit easier than the astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
So far this year, the ISS has performed not one but three evasive maneuvers in order to avoid colliding with random space debris. The most recent event, on September 22nd, required a coordinated thruster burn by both US and Russian astronauts to ensure their safety. Ground control was so concerned, they requested the astronauts shelter near the Soyuz spacecraft, to be ready to evacuate at a moment's notice.

Hello and welcome to Talis Evolvere Metal Dice Relaunch!
For those who don't know me, I have been playing tabletop games for more than 15 years and have loved dice well before then. Unique dice that fit my mood or my character are something that especially resonates with me. I founded Robin's Nerd Supplies in 2018 to allow me to spend more time with tabletop games. As a company, we try to cater to the needs of gamers that want unique dice to suit their individuality.
One thing that always disappointed me though was that I could never find attractive eye-catching dice for when playing in non-English languages. Robin's Nerd Supplies is hoping to change that with the Talis Evolvere line. Talis Evolvere will include dice in a variety of languages and styles. Last year we successfully Kickstarted our first set: the resin Kanji Dice.

campaign.story:
Reforge is a card game about building swords and fighting your friends. 
It was created and funded on Kickstarter in 2019 by myself, Stephen Royka (designer), and Sam Donez (artist). In Reforge, players race to forge and reforge more powerful swords while at the same time trying to defeat each other! Player's take turns adding or swapping parts to their blade, putting up protection with shields, playing game changing gadgets, and attacking an opponent! All players start with the weak Adventurer blade and slowly forge up to more powerful, crazy blades! Check out the website for detailed rules and more!
I (Stephen) work full time at a hospital in Southwest Florida as an Ultrasound Technologist. It has been a difficult time amidst the pandemic, but I'm happy to be able to relaunch this campaign between the crazy work hours. Game design is a passion I pursue on the side, creating things that I (and hopefully other people) love!
This is the relaunch of the Reforge Worlds: Volume I campaign, which was unsuccessful earlier this year. After some adjustments, I hope this campaign has what it takes to reach funding!
This how-to video was made by a fan of the game. Check it out for some pretty well made instruction!
What if I don't own Reforge?
No need to worry! Reforge: Kickstarter Edition is available through this campaign alone and together with the expansion for a special discounted price! You also have the option to order Reforge directly from the website if you'd like it immediately, as rewards from this campaign will not ship until the campaign ends and the funds are collected. If you're not in a hurry, though, the campaign is the way to go. This way you can help us reach the stretch goals!
The First Expansion!
Reforge Worlds: Volume I is the first expansion for Reforge and will add 36+ cards (depending on stretch goals met) to the game! It will continue the game's crazy blend of chaos with new blades, parts, shields, and gadgets. It will include three distinct themes:
Deep Space (Sci Fi Themed)
Faraway Land (Fantasy Themed)
Kickstarter Forge (Crowdfunding Themed)
The Kickstarter Forge theme will include blades that fans and backers of Reforge envisioned and our artist, Sam, made a reality! This continues my mission of getting the community involved with the creation of my games. Three of the blades in the final version of Reforge (The Narwhal, The Written Word, The Anthology) were actually conceived by Kickstarter backers!
By popular demand, we have added d12 blades! Forge even farther with these overpowered weapons of destruction! Oh, and did someone say gadgets? We've got some of the craziest gadgets ever in this expansion that are sure to shake up games. Details on all of the cards are below!
Stretch Goals!
And how! I wanted to make this campaign more engaging to backers, so I upped the ante on stretch goals! Through these goals we will be able to add more blades and gadgets to the expansion pack, as well as create the super special Spirit Expansion! 
The Spirit Expansion?!
The stretch goal of $9,000 will fund a smaller expansion that will add an entirely new gameplay mechanic to Reforge. The Spirit Expansion will let players who have fallen in battle continue to affect the course of the game! These special cards will be kept in a small deck separate from the Armory. When a player is defeated, they draw 3 and can use them whenever they want for the rest of the game! Help or hinder players that have helped or hindered you. I'm really excited about this expansion, so I hope we make it this far! If we do, the new pledge tier will be become available and backers will be able to add $9 to their pledge to get The Spirit Expansion! Everyone who gets the Special Tiers will automatically get this expansion if funded.
Awesome Rewards!
We've got em! It wouldn't be a Secret Boss Games Kickstarter without a new enamel pin, so we've got The Loves-Me-Not blade in pin form! There are also some special tiers for those of you that want to make your mark on the game.
*Add $5 to your pledge for enamel pins featuring The Loves-Me-Not and The Goodboye!
*Add $3 to your pledge for a Secret Boss Games holographic logo sticker!
Creator Tier Instructions
If you back The Creator tier, you get to create your VERY OWN BLADE! You will create this on your own using one of two methods. Here you will find the templates to make your blade. Be sure to follow the instructions provided carefully so we get it set up right for you! It will then be shipped with your copy of Reforge Worlds: Volume I. All Creation art should be sent to me by Friday, June 26th.
Sponsor + Highest Tier Pledger Instructions
If you back The Sponsor or The Highest Tier Pledger, you also get your name on a card that will be in the expansion forever! Please email your name formatted exactly how you would like it printed (first/last name only may be used depending on length) at stephen@secretbossgames.com.
Production
The expansion will be printed by AdMagic, the printer of Reforge: Kickstarter Edition, to ensure the best quality product I can give you! AdMagic did great work on the base game, so I'm thrilled be able to work with them again for this expansion!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge is getting everything produced and shipped on time. The production of Reforge last year took a little longer than expected and shipped in January, 2020 rather than the planned date of December, 2019. This was mainly due to changes that needed to take place during the production process (mainly upgrades to dice, box design, and card quality). I have learned a lot about the production and shipment process since then and am confident that we will meet shipping estimates for the Reforge Expansions.

During this difficult time, it's hard to say how future production will be impacted. I have purposefully pushed the expected ship date back to October (later than I would expect) for some wiggle room as the world continues to fight the battle against the pandemic.

Fortunately, all cards for the expansions have already been completed! As soon as the Kickstarter funds are deposited, production on the expansions should be able to start with no delay on my end. This should ensure the quickest possible production process.

I'm using the wonderful AdMagic to print the expansion. They did fantastic work on the base Reforge game, so I'm thrilled to be working with them again!

Rest assured that any delay means I am making changes to ensure I ship the best possible product I can!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
After two unsuccessful campaigns to create the first Reforge Expansion, I’ve decided to do the next best thing and get The Spirit Expansion printed and packaged on my own! These cards are being printed by MPC (Make Playing Cards). This is a different printer than AdMagic, the manufacturer of Reforge, and it allows me to order cards with no minimum required order. Due to the different printer, the cards will have slight variation in shape and material. This works out well due to the nature of The Spirit Expansion - it will be kept completely separate from your current Reforge cards and even has a cool new backing.
Players who have fallen in battle will now have the opportunity to change the course of the battle! The Spirit Expansion includes 15 brand new cards, each with a different effect that can be used on surviving players. When a player is defeated, they will draw 1-3 cards (depending on the number of remaining players) that can be used at any time for the remainder of the game. This will keep defeated players not only invested in the action, but directly involved with it! Hinder a rival or help a friend with tools like the Tombstone, Ghoulshot, and Ectoplasm!

We've crept closer to the end date of this campaign and, although everyone involved has been incredibly supportive, it seems we likely won't make it to the goal. After a lot of thought I've decided to cancel the campaign for Reforge Worlds: Volume I.
This and the previous campaign for Reforge Worlds went live during a very difficult time in the world. While this isn't an excuse for a lousy Kickstarter campaign, it does account for a loss where previously I had the most success: in person events. Meeting future fans of the game at events like Florida Supercon was the driving force of the previous campaign and, unfortunately, all such events were cancelled this year (and for good reason). I may have initially underestimated the role that they played in Reforge's initial success.

Travelers!
In these uncertain times it has been difficult to gauge this campaign. It has run into a similar problem as the previous, being stunted around the halfway point. There has been notably less engagement with this campaign that I can most definitely attribute to lack of in person events. Showing people the game first hand has always been the best way to get people excited. Even so, I will continue on. If we reach the final days and are nowhere near our goal, then I will reassess, but for now I want to see where this goes. I'm thrilled that you are on this ride with me!

Hello travelers!
I know that the last week has proven difficult for many people in the US and beyond. I have found myself affected by the state of the world in emotional ways I have not experienced before. 2020 has proven itself a formidable beast. That being said, I have been unable to upload video updates on a weekly basis as I would have liked. Expect one this weekend!
The upcoming video will share information about the expansion as well as some thoughts about the state of the Kickstarter campaign. With both a successful and unsuccessful campaign behind me, I have ideas about the best course of action moving forward to try and get this funded!

Travelers,
Like I promised, here is the first of the weekly vlogs that will show some new info on some of the cards you'll encounter in Reforge Worlds! Today we're checking out some new crowdfunding themed gadgets!

Travelers,
It was an amazing first day for Reforge Worlds: Volume I! We are already at 27% of our goal! This is fantastic, but it's good to note that the previous attempt at this campaign also had a big first couple days before it stagnated. I'll be doing my best to keep getting the word out.
To keep things interesting, I let's do some giveaways!

Mini Rogue is a minimalist dungeon crawler board game in which one or two players delve into a deep dungeon in order to get a mysterious ruby called the Og's Blood.
The players must choose how to spend their resources to be powerful enough to confront ever more difficult monsters and hazards. Randomly generated levels and encounters make every playthrough a unique experience!
 A Thematic Roguelike Experience - An engaging game profoundly inspired by roguelikes and old-school dungeon crawlers. Every floor is randomly laid out, each game plays out differently, and of course, death is final.
Minimal Setup - This game takes seconds to set up and makes for quick, tense dungeon romps.
Make Choices - Will you spend your coins at the Merchant's stall for some health points, or choose to fight the Skeleton Soldier for some much-needed experience points before facing greater odds? Many more dilemmas await you!
New Co-op Mode - You can now enlist a fellow friend to help you out on the quest to retrieve the Og's Blood!
Better than Ever - Manipulations have been streamlined, the difficulty has been balanced, and new unique cards make for unexpected encounters.
New Characters  - Will you conjure powerful potions as the Mage, or play as the sneaky Rogue with deadly hands? Each Character comes with unique skills!

 Designers: Paolo Di Stefano and Gabriel Gendron. 
Paolo is a creative coder harking back to the old Flash experiential days, and evolved into an interface developer with just over 13 years of experience, 8 of which were in the video game industry. Teaming up with Gabriel to found Mountain Gold Games, Mini Rogue was born out of their shared love for everything dungeon, CRPGs, boardgames, and a host of other common interests in music, food, and art.
Gabriel is a game designer and UI/UX designer by trade with more than 10 years of experience, most notably in the video game industry. His first published design, Mini Rogue, has been awarded multiple awards in the BGG contest community. Together with Paolo, he's an avid fan of rogue-likes, old school dungeon crawlers and CRPGs. He is also the co-founder of Mountain Gold Games.
 Artist: Gabriel Gendron.
 Video animator: Jon Mietling.
   Publishers: Mountain Gold Games and Nuts! Publishing.
  Mountain Gold Games is the name of Gabriel Gendron and Paolo Di Stefano’s adventure in game development, it’s a labor of love for the craft and a true tale of friendship. Our motto? Quality, not quantity.
Nuts! Publishing is a game publisher. Mini Rogue is our third Kickstarter (our previous ones were Saigon 75 and This War Without an Enemy). We have already published 14 games (including the French versions of Palm Island, One Deck Dungeon, and Red7) and have done 4 other Kickstarter campaigns as localization partners (Auztralia, The Great War, D-Day Dice and Gloom of Kilforth).
Partners will be announced soon. We're in talks for the Italian & German languages.
These versions won't be funded during this Kickstarter, if you want a German or an Italian version of Mini Rogue, you don't have pledge to this campaign.
Nuts! Publishing is a small company and by pledging now, you will help us to publish this game. Without your help, we won't be able to print Mini Rogue. You will also receive Kickstarter exclusive content (the expansion Old Gods won't be available after the Kickstarter except during some conventions and promotional events) and have a special discount (the MSRP for the base game is $23.8 / 22€, the MSRP  for the All-in is $84.5 / 75€).

campaign.story:
Full rules for Dice Miner's solo mode are also available for download, or you can watch producer Jeff Tidball walk you through a solo mode play-though:
"The drafting is quite fun!… The Beer dice symbols allow you to really set up the mountain." —Will Keeler, Roll for Crit
"As the turns go on, you amass more and more dice… What you’re thinking about and what your strategy might be for the long game is really going to progress as things go on." —Jonathan Estis, Roll for Crit 
“The ‘mountain’ dice tray is awesome!” —John G., Playtester
“Right up my alley. And I love dice!” —Ben M., Playtester
In the Dice Miner Kickstarter, everyone’s working together to earn Gems that unlock stretch goals. Backers vote on which goals to work toward next. 
Due to the overwhelming response to the Dice Miner campaign, every stretch goal we planned to offer — and some that we didn't plan — has been unlocked. There is always the temptation, when a campaign is exceeding expectations, to pile on more and more stretch goals. We've reached the limit of what we think we can responsibly deliver, so we're drawing a happy line under what's been unlocked and get to work delivering on our promises.
Thank you, backers!
The Dice Miner backer pack is a collection of components and extras delivered only to Kickstarter backers. The exact contents of the backer pack depend on which stretch goals are unlocked, as decided by you, the backers. 
When bonus tunnel dice are unlocked, the ones you get in your backer pack will depend on which version of the game you're getting. Standard backers will get Standard Edition bonus dice, Deluxe backers will get Deluxe Edition bonus dice. 
Bonus Goals
"Adventuring Party" Play Mode: If six new heroes are unlocked, the "Adventuring Party" play mode will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download. In this mode, each player gets three heroes per game, and uses a different one in each round. This bonus goal has been unlocked!
Liquid Courage Dice Game: If five tunnel dice are unlocked, a brand new dice game called Liquid Courage will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download. Created by our friends Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann at Steve Jackson Games, we'll let Sam tell you more below. This bonus goal has been unlocked! 
My co-designer, Randy Scheunemann, and I set out to create a variety of dice games that offer interesting choices and give players some control over how the game plays out. Yes, even the randomness of dice games can include meaningful choices!
We spent months working with this goal in mind, we designed a ton of different games, and then we ultimately narrowed it all down to 26 that we feel are the best of the bunch. Those games are all featured in our book, Random Fun Generator — A Collection of Dice Games, which will be offered in an upcoming Kickstarter campaign from Steve Jackson Games.
One of those games, Liquid Courage, was designed specifically for Atlas Games, with the awesome custom dice from Dice Miner in mind, and we hope you enjoy it! 
— Sam Mitschke / Chief Creative Officer / Steve Jackson Games 
We'll alert Dice Miner backers about the Random Fun Generator Kickstarter when it goes  live, but you can also monitor dice.sjgames.com, where the book will feature prominently when it launches. We're extremely happy to feature Liquid Courage as a stretch goal for Dice Miner backers.
Liquid Courage is best played with six tunnel dice per player, but we're unlocking it with the fifth backer pack tunnel die because backers can still play it easily by using the 27 tunnel dice form their copies of Dice Miner. If more tunnel die are added to the backer pack after the fifth one, so much the better.
The campaign mines Gems in four ways: basic, first day, social media, and challenges.
Basic
One Dollar of Funding = 1 Gem
One Backer = 2 Gems
First-Day
One First-Day Dollar = 3 Extra Gems*
One First-Day Backer = 5 Extra Gems*
* First-day Gem rewards are over and above the “basic gems” amount for dollars and backers.
Social Media
One New @AtlasGamesInsta Instagram Follower = 5 Gems
One New Atlas Games Facebook Page Like = 3 Gems
One New Atlas Games YouTube Subscriber = 3 Gems
One New @AtlasGames Twitter Follower = 2 Gem
  Challenges

 Mine for Dice on Instagram (Post an image on Instagram of dice you have discovered within or placed inside a hole of some kind, and tag #tabletop and @AtlasGamesInsta) = 35 Gems

You’ll pay later for shipping. You keep more of your money longer, and shipping rates will be as close as possible to actual cost. Trust us, we won’t make any money on shipping.
Rewards will ship from the Atlas Games warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota, USA. Based on our experience, this is more reliable and ultimately less expensive than a collection of global partners. In part due to our direct control of this facility, our shipping operations have remained both open and safe during the global pandemic.
You’ll prepay taxes later. (Group pledges are an exception— see below.) This allows rewards traveling outside the US to be sent “Delivery Duty Paid” (DDP) where available, so international packages shouldn’t be delayed at customs or flagged for extra fees. Backing Dice Miner on Kickstarter is not a useful way to avoid paying your local government’s taxes.
Here are the shipping, handling, and pre-paid taxes we anticipate by destination country. They are our best estimates, not guarantees.
For group pledge tiers, we will collect shipping and handling after the campaign. We will not charge for duties or taxes, nor pre-pay them, nor be involved in their administration or payment whatsoever. For group pledges, duties and taxes are the backer’s responsibility.
This campaign will not ship rewards to Afghanistan, Brazil, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, or Ukraine.
From the day we begin shipping, you’ll have a year to complete your order and pay for shipping and taxes. Pledges unclaimed after a year will be assumed abandoned.
Retail tier backers use Atlas Games’ standard direct-to-retail sales terms for shipping. See “Stones & Mortar,” below.
Add-ons will be available in the pledge management phase of the campaign. In addition to a variety of other Atlas Games titles, you’ll be able to add the following.
Punchboard Mountain — $8. Available to everyone, but intended mostly for Deluxe backers who would also like to have a punchboard mountain, in addition to a plastic mountain.
Deluxe Dice Set — $18. Available to everyone, but intended mostly for Standard backers who prefer the look of the punchboard mountain to the look of the plastic mountain, but who dig fancy dice. (We understand that a Standard Edition pledge plus a deluxe dice set costs about the same as a Deluxe Edition pledge. It reflects what the dice cost, and the fact that you wind up with 120 dice instead of only 60.) Includes a Deluxe Edition dice bag.
Standard Dice Set — $14. Available to everyone, added by popular demand. This is a full set of the sixty dice that come in the Standard Edition. Includes a Standard Edition dice bag.
Standard-to-Deluxe Upgrade — $18. Available to backers at the "Standard Group" pledge level only. Each of these add-ons upgrades one of the five Standard Edition games that are part of that pledge level to a Deluxe Edition game. This allows the two editions to be be mixed among a group of gamers who are backing together.
Josh DeBonis is the president of BumbleBear Games, where he designs arcade games. He lives in Brooklyn, NY, with his wife Amanda.
Nikola Risteski is French-born, residing in the US, managing IT by day, designing board games by night. He lives in Hoboken, NJ with his wife Siri and two kids, Anna and Kyle who are already Dice Miner Masters.
Dice Miner is Niko and Josh's second collaboration. Their first game together, Isle of Monsters, was released in 2017.
Jason has over a decade of professional experience designing and producing game components. He has a talent for blinking in photographs. 
Lil creates art for novel and narrative-driven games experiences. She enjoys deep conversations and unearthing the mysteries of a rotisserie chicken's skeleton.
Brigette is a full-time graphic designer and art director specializing in board game graphic design and logo design. Other roles include: theme party planner, extrovert, Star Trek enthusiast, and cat lover.
Co-owners of Atlas Games, John and Michelle have brought hundreds of exceptional card games, board games, and RPGs to fans around the world, over their 30+ years in the industry. Weirdly, their own kids prefer video games.
Greg is a veteran board game illustrator on projects like Conan, Star Trek, and Numenera. He became an artist so he could visit countless worlds without leaving his favorite chair. 
Jeff has designed, developed, or produced more than 50 board and card games. He is made of 85% Bert and 15% Ernie. 
Campaign ends: June 23, 2020
Pledge management launches: Early August, 2020
Regular pledge management ends: Early October, 2020
Backer shipments complete: End of November, 2020
Regular retail street date: January 15, 2021*
  These are our plans and best guesses. Our estimated delivery in January takes into account the fact that things sometimes go wrong.
* Retail backers may sell Dice Miner as soon as they receive their orders.
We believe that healthy retailers are key to a healthy hobby. We have a reputation for taking care of our retailer partners, and our Kickstarter campaigns are no exception. This campaign is retail-friendly because:
 The discount is what you expect. Your pledge gives you dollar-for-dollar credit to buy whatever mix of Standard and Deluxe Editions are right for your store, at our standard discount (50%) and regular shipping terms.
 The price is the price. Our campaign offers the standard edition at $29 (MSRP: $29.95) and the Deluxe Edition at $49 (MSRP: $49.95). Our Kickstarter does not undercut long-term sales.
 Exclusive Deluxe Edition access. The Deluxe Edition of Dice Miner will not be made available through distribution.
 You’ll get it before your competitors. Dice Miner’s channel street date is January 15, 2021, but if all goes according to plan (not guaranteed, but likely), you’ll receive your copies in early December and can sell them right away.
 Retail-only stretch goal. If 100 retail stores back Dice Miner, every one will receive a free demo copy of the Standard Edition. (As a point of reference, 124 retailers backed our last campaign.)

At Atlas Games we’ve launched and delivered four Kickstarter campaigns, with our fifth currently in development and pending fulfillment. We’d call your attention especially to the backer updates for Magical Kitties Save the Day, to give you a sense of how we handle things and what we do when the unexpected arises. At the same time: Yes, indeed, many things seem very uncertain these days. There are definitely risks that COVID-19 will disrupt our supply chain or affect our staff members. We promise that as challenges arise we will be transparent, plan sensible solutions, and keep you informed.

Backer Shipments in Progress
Backer shipments are underway, although not quite entirely finished. We’ve received word from many backers that their rewards have arrived safely, and that Dice Miner is now being played around the world.
A fair number of backers have reported that they were surprised by their shipments because they hadn’t received tracking information. Learn to Play on Dized

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update: We Have the Games!
updates.update_content:
We Have the Games!
A truck containing the Dice Miner shipment arrived at our warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota this morning. We have photographic proof!

Ever Smart Making Good Time
Our tracking data suggests that the ship carrying our container of Dice Miner, the Ever Smart, is likely to arrive in Tacoma this afternoon. This is great news!
Keep in mind that there are often unexpected delays at port. We know that there will be some delays while the shipment is transloaded onto a truck for freighting to Minnesota. And of course, the trucking will also take time. But at this point, the number of left-field delays that might befall us continues to narrow the more legs of the journey we complete.
Pledge Manager Deadline

We Finally Kicked That Football
We got word from our freight forwarder that our May 8 sail date came true, and our container of Dice Miner is now en route from Shanghai.
Hooray!
What’s Next?

Not On the Water Yet
Our April 21 sailing didn’t succeed, but the strategies we discussed in our last update — meeting with our freight forwarder and expanding our list of possible entry ports — seem to be helping.
Routing the shipment to Tacoma seems like our best bet, so that’s the port we’re focusing on. Tacoma doesn’t have weeks worth of freighters backed up on the water waiting to unload, like Los Angeles does. Tacoma have pretty bad rail yard congestion at the moment, so it’s not without issues. But still.

April 4 Was a Bust
We learned last week that our booked sailing on April 4 failed. The next potential sail date we’ve received from our freight forwarder is April 21. This is terribly disappointing.
We're trying two new tactics, at this point, to increase the odds of successfully getting our games out of Shanghai:
We Are All Charlie Brown

No Steps Forward, One Step Back
As we reported in our last backer update, the Dice Miner shipment missed its first sailing date. Since then, our games have missed two additional sailing dates, the first on January 24, the second on February 7.
On top of that, we learned that contrary to our report in the last update, the Dice Miner shipment has not yet even been picked up from the factory. This makes some sense in retrospect. Since the factory is in relatively close proximity to the Shanghai port, if it’s known that a freighter booking has fallen apart, picking the games up from the factory only incurs the liability of additional storage fees until one of our bookings finally comes true, and does not even increase the chances of successfully making later bookings.

Shipping Update
The full shipment of Dice Miner games left the factory within a day or two of the December 22 departure date we estimated in our last update.
Our container is now (still) waiting at the port of Shanghai for its sail date. Why? Our freight forwarder advised us last week that our original booking was a “blank sailing.” This turns out to be a logistics term of art that describes a ship that plain didn’t show up where it was scheduled to be. If you’re interested in reading more, . (Universal Cargo is not our freight forwarder, but had the best explanation of a blank sailing on the first page of search results.)

Production Update
It has been a while since our last update, and although there is not very much that’s new or interesting to report, we’d like to keep you up to date.
Testing samples were produced and shipped to our contract lab on more or less the timeline we expected in our last update. The testing process alerted us to a few minor issues, but we were able to deal with them relatively easily, and without delaying the production process. (The process was not delayed because the testing process ran in parallel with the balance of bulk dice production, per our report in the last update.)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Stronghold Games has learned how to streamline the game publishing process and has successfully delivered games to thousands of its supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Terraforming Mars: Big Box will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS

We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS

If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY

Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Update - the end is in sight!
updates.update_content:
Executives,
We’re here with another update about the rolling fulfillment for your pledges. We’re nearing the end, and have hope that you’ll all see your games in the next few weeks! 
Regional Shipping Updates:

Hello terraformers,
I come bearing news! Everything is moving along, and orders are being shipped out all over the world. Overall, this massive undertaking of fulfillment is going well, but not without some issues. You can find more detailed information about your region's fulfillment below. Rolling fulfillment is a long process as we can’t ship orders for which the component pieces haven’t arrived. We appreciate your patience - overall, we’re in the middle of a month-long process. Even without a rolling fulfillment, this was a huge project that would take weeks to complete. And remember, we don’t like this rolling fulfillment any more than you do - but the sheer scope of the project (over 11 containers of games), and the vast, ongoing supply chain issues caused by COVID made it the best way to get games to you. But even if it is the best way, it certainly is showing the ugly side of the freight game that backers usually don’t see. The fact that so much progress has been made means our fulfillment centers are showing off their work ethic!

Hello executives,
I’m back only a week later with exciting news. As you may have noticed, some of you have started getting shipping notifications - and we are super excited about that! Let’s break down exactly what that means, and again ask for everyone’s patience as this is going to be a rolling fulfillment over the course of a month.
First, some (but not all!) of the containers arrived at each of the different fulfillment centers. Our great partners have been super busy unloading the containers and getting packages started on their way to you without delay - this is the fastest turnaround time we have ever had between containers arriving and packages leaving the warehouse.  Since there are so many packages in these containers, we need to make sure there is a constant flow out so that the fulfillment centers don’t run out of room when new containers come in - which is a big reason why we are doing a rolling fulfilment rather than waiting for all the containers to arrive and then starting the shipments.

Hey backers time for a brief update!
Please remember this is a huge fulfilment project – in total there are 10 full containers for backer rewards, in the middle of a global pandemic that has had significant effects on freight. For many reasons we are doing a rolling fulfillment process ( meaning we send out rewards as we receive them in the fulfillment warehouses, not wait for everything to arrive) with a number of our other projects that are shipping from China around the same time. That means some packages will go out much sooner than others, possibly greater than a month difference between people with the same orders.
