campaign.story:
The Mineralogy Manual is a world-building guide to provide Dungeon Masters and Players with the tools to craft their worlds from the ground up (quite literally). The focus of this book by Deep Dungeon Games is the ground on which we stand - the earth itself and all the wonders it contains.
The Mineralogy Manual has been designed to be extremely easy to learn and use for any tabletop role-playing game, or the foundation for any type of fiction. It can be a fun addition to your long-running game or the start of a brand new short adventure. The book will come alive in your mind's eye through its beautiful and professional illustrations.
The Mineralogy Manual also includes a set of five complete adventures (using the 5th Edition ruleset), designed from the ground up to showcase the different aspects of the mineral and elemental resources showcased in the book. This provides an excellent introduction to many different systems and can act as the perfect starting point for a whole earthen or Dwarven campaign. These adventures are ready to run as soon as you get the book, including everything you’ll need to craft your versions of named metal swords, armor, and other earthen devices.
The NPC cards from the Decks of Casual Characters offer a perfect complement to your copy of the book.
The book is expected to contain a whopping 400 to 450 pages. The exact number will depend on how many of the stretch goals are met since each will add significant text and imagery to the book. You really will get your money's worth! The Mineralogy Manual is filled to the brim, including sections on fantasy elements, minerals, ores, mines, mining companies, and even a fully developed Dwarven language.
The tome cards from the Deck of the Arbitrary Athenaeum offer a perfect complement to your copy of the book. Deal your player’s real books from your world as they find new and exciting tales within them.
The book can be obtained as either a Digital or a Physical copy, with some tiers getting both versions. The Digital copy is DRM and watermark-free; the Physical copy is a hardcover 8.5"x11" book.
In the hope of giving you a bit of a summary, The Mineralogy Manual contains the following features, sections, and content to kickstart your underground adventure:
 Treasures of the Earth including 50 Elements, 40 types of Minerals, 30 types of Rocks and 20 types of Ores.
 The Crafting of the Earth including 20 varieties of Gemstones, 20 varieties of Crystals, and 20 types of Metals in all of its forms.
 Hollowing of the Earth including Magic Ley Lines, 10 fully detailed Mines, and 100 Non-Player Characters to fill up your fantasy mines.
 Children of the Earth, featuring 2,000 ready-to-use words in the Dwarven Language, 4 Dwarven Clans, 4 Dwarven Cities, 5 Earthen Dungeons, and 10 individual Natural Locations.
As the Kickstarter progresses, we will be adding the current goal and all the achieved goals right here! This is so you as the backer will have an easy time checking up on the progress and what goodies are next.
Thanks for checking out the Kickstarter. You can click here to download a free sample of Dwarven Dice Games and the Dwarven Inspired 5e Character Sheet! Thank you for spending the time and checking out the project! 
All the features in this section comprise the entire earthen world and the treasures it holds. While some of these are rare, chaotic, or dangerous, they still mix and mold to make up all of the substances in the material realms. Everything comes from the true treasures of the earth and this chapter covers these treasures in their purest, raw forms. Gemstones, crystals, and rare metal ingots would never have been able to form without the true treasures below.
Elements are the source: the building blocks of all minerals, rocks, and everything else from the earth.
 Blighted Elements consist of Clode, Dune, Anima, and Conquitus. In most locations of the realms, it is thought these elements come from another universe or dimension where the laws of physics are slightly different, allowing them to be stable.
 Chaos Elements consist of Kindra, Granius, Halos, Aquifis, Vitae, Soros, and Thun. In most locations in the realms, they are rarely found due to their volatile nature with their own counter elements.
 Dwarven Elements consist of Claire, Fulg, Galvan, Fara, Flaris, Obasus, Lustrous, Thawe, Halo, Pulvi, Flaik, Scaldor, and Ragnis. Unlike chain metals, these metals are more often found in minerals than they are naturally.
 Foundation Elements consist of Coles, Magmith, Avalan, Lutum, Hydrox, Mores, Vox, Bron, Theron, and Monsoo. These elements are the most plentiful in the realms and mostly located in the ground.
 Rune Elements consist of Precipise, Eros, and Adum, and though found in many forms they are among the rarest. They are found naturally but more often take the form of minerals, crystals, and gemstones.
 Chain Metal Elements consist of Aflyx, Striutrium, Lobrese, Mashiydian, Espum, Nustum, and Lathian. These metals are found in minerals and rocks like many others but trace their origin back to the times of creation.
 Unseen Elements consist of Oxyn, Mistrath, Soleis, Lux and Disaris. They exist everywhere in the realms but are invisible to the eye, mingling to form the air that fills our lungs.
Minerals are compounds that can be divided into their constituent elements.
 Wizard Minerals are unique in several ways. The most notable is that these minerals typically need to be removed from the earth using magical means.
 Apothecary Minerals typically require chemicals for both identifying the mineral and to make removal from the earth easier.
 Devotion Minerals contain a variety of gemstones, particularly rare ones. Unlike the majority of minerals, which can only form a single gemstone, devotion minerals produce many different gemstones of different colors, varieties, sizes, and rarities.
 Primal Minerals are the purest state of basic energies of the material plane in physical form. These minerals are some of the strongest for pure arcane, divine, and primordial magics.
 Blacksmithing Minerals produce a certain amount of utility for the crafting of weapons, armor, or other metallic wonders, and are the most ore-producing minerals across the realms.
 Noble Minerals are often associated with the other chain metal elements and have connections with coinage, riches, and many of the noble families. These minerals can be found in all levels of the earth in its tarnished form.
Rocks are generally composed of an assemblage of minerals and occur in three different forms or varieties.
 Primordial Rocks are formed from the elemental forces and deities primarily through wind, water, fire, and the earth; they comprise most of the surface of the realms.
 Mistral Rocks were once Primordial Rocks that were forever changed by the magic of the realms into totally new forms.
 Geoaegis Rocks were once Primordial or Mistral rocks that were broken apart by time and elemental forces, and then later reformed by the same forces into layers or clusters of different types of rocks.
Ore is defined as an economic concentration of minerals. The richness of ores can be vastly different, depending on the minerals and elements involved.
 Trace Ores contain tiny amounts of many different minerals; the percentages of these minerals can vary from piece to piece.
 Affix Ores have elements and minerals that are often used in a recipe or formula to make alloys, potions, and other complex items.
 True Ores are composed heavily of one type of mineral or element and are often the most sought-after for their overall purity.
As the individuals in our fantasy worlds go on about their routines, they use natural resources from the earth in their everyday lives. It is important to consider the form of that earthen resource and that the characters interact and craft with the resources everyday. Though most blacksmiths and jewelers would love to work exclusively with precious metals and gems, there is often much more involved when crafting with earthen materials. This chapter provides you with gemstones, crystals, and metals to fully immerse you and your characters in your fantasy worlds.  
Gemstones of the realms are found in many shapes and varieties. They form most commonly in the rocks and minerals that have undergone powerful elemental changes. A gemstone typically comes in one of three different forms.
 Precious Gemstones are highly sought-after, as there are only 6 varieties of gemstone known to exist that can claim the true title of ‘precious’.
 Semi-Precious Gemstones are basically every other gemstone that isn’t classified as a true precious gemstone, with the exception of...
 Magical Gemstones, which are rare and form only near the primal and magical Ley Lines deep in the earth. One may have a magical gemstone and not even be aware.
Crystals are beautiful, solid, often shiny earthen structures that are extremely geometric and semi-translucent in their natural shape.
 Bonding Crystals tend to bond with one if a certain spell or ritual is performed. This bonding takes a variety of forms depending on its origins, but the boons the crystals can bring are highly sought-after by Geomancers.
 Dwarven Crystals are valuable for the great boon they provide to metal crafting. Geomancers and blacksmiths use them to form Anethum and Thentine alloys.
 Mystic Crystals are formed due to their close proximity to the magical Ley Lines of the realms. The majority of these crystals possess a large amount of unspent arcane energy and are used as a spell focus and for spell crafting, enchanting, and soul magics.
 Force Crystals have close ties to the primordial magic from the time of creation. The majority of them have been trapped within the earth for untold years.
Metals are found in ores, rich minerals, and rocks and must be extracted to form ingots which can later be crafted into items, weapons or tools. Metals can also be combined into alloys which make an overall stronger metal.
 Pure Metals can be found in nature but generally must be extracted or combined from minerals and ores.
 Anethum is an alloy that requires crystals to be combined with the metal.
 Thentine requires the combinations of crystals, metals, and magical gemstones to makes a most unique alloy for metalworking.
When searching for valuable minerals, the traditional prospector relies primarily on the direct observation of minerals in outcrops, sediments, and soil. The modern prospector also employs a combination of geologic, geophysical, and geomancy tools to provide indirect indications for good locations to begin hollowing the earth.
The Ley Lines are magical, mystical alignments within the earth that connect other planes to the material realms. Many of the arcane mystics who study the art of Geomancy believe that these lines carry positive or negative energy.  This section of the book will cover what they are and how to add them to your world with ease.
Many new Dwarven strongholds and landlocked cities of the realms are founded near substantial deposits of minerals or gems. This section contains rules for establishing and operating mines. It is presumed that most existing strongholds are built around profitable and extensive ones.
Every mine needs individuals to work them, manage them, and protect them. This section provides a massively detailed list of 100 NPCs to be used in the mines from this book or plugged into your existing worlds.
While every race can trace its origin to the elements of the realms, there are certain races, monsters, and creatures that are more closely tied to the underground regions. Not all the children of the earth have legs and arms like the majority of the creatures. The children of the earth can also take the form of the beautiful creations of landforms, mountains, and more. This chapter will break down the environments, those monsters within them, where they exist, and so much more further detailed below.
Many races in a fantasy setting have a form of communication that is common among them and their societies. This section of the book will break down the phonology, morphology, syntax, word construction, and alphabet of the original language of the Dwarves. It will also contain an easy to use phrasebook and dictionary containing 2,000 words ready-to-use by those who should know the language.
This section examines the lifestyle of the Dwarves, the organization of their clans, and the dwarven family, the smallest unit of dwarf social organization. The clans are the basis of dwarf society. A few dwarves follow professions that set them apart, but they are still influenced by mainstream Dwarf society, its values, and structures.
Most Dwarves choose life underground, and while it is unusual for them to live in a surface settlement unless events force them upwards, it is not impossible. The origins of these cities spring from the unique world view of the many clans that spent thousands of years living underground.
This section includes a variety of dungeons from the different clans in the book and will explore the different elements of fire, ice, earth, and disease. 
 Dungeon One: A Return to Mullodar – The Dwarven clans have come together in hopes of regaining the four long-lost relics of their ancient stronghold. Can the party clear this deadly dungeon of pestilence and disease and return the Dwarven relics to their rightful homes? 
 Dungeon Two: The Pit of Gnawed Bones – The rise of new and powerful Trolls within the Copper Mountains has seen the local Dwarven and Halfing communities under attack. Thrown in the deep end of an immense set of caves, the party will fight their way back to the light.
 Dungeon Three: Qannesdam – The fires of Mount Blackpeak have gone cold, the Ashfoot clan's livelihood placed on the line. To restart the fiery core that beats within the mountain, the party will have to face the heat and flames of the isle of Qannesdam and return with an Elemental Heart of Fire.
 Dungeon Four: Mesmerizing Ice Vault – Deep within the heart of the Ridgeline Mountains lays the tomb of Kyvierrun, The Ice Scaled. Or so it has long been told. But with the beating crashes of the Frosthammer Dwarves' iron picks, this mighty Dragon has awoken. 
 Dungeon Five: The Skyfall Tradition – The Skyfall clan lays open for the taking, the decade-long rule of Lunac Skyfall coming to an end. From the list of contenders, a new chieftain will arise. Can an influential party change the course of history for a clan on the verge of a new beginning?
This section includes 10 individual, unique locations that are highly adaptable to any campaign and can form a unique variety of terrains and environments. Game Masters can add these into their worlds with very little effort as we provide the environment, important locations, flora and fauna, inhabitants, dangers, a battle map, and more, all ready for adventuring.
We've prepared several sample pages that will give you an idea of the contents present in the book as well as the general layout. These were created from a first draft to give you an understanding of what the pages will look like; actual layout, fonts, and text will likely change by the final release to improve the overall quality of the manual.
 CLICK HERE FOR SAMPLE PAGES 
A lot of work has gone into creating and compiling the massive amount of information and gameplay we're packing into The Mineralogy Manual. Once we finish up this Kickstarter there will still be much to do, including editing, layout, proofing, finalization, printing and shipping. Here's our timeline for the project.
 Click here for the rewards spreadsheet version created by K Wirick 
  All content forThe Mineralogy Manual has been completely written and the majority of the illustrations are complete.
From the get-go, we pledged that this book must be visually stunning. That means not only the artwork but the layout and presentation as well. This process usually takes 2 to 3 months, and our editor for the majority of our books has made his career in the realm of editing.
The general layout has already been defined as you can see in the sample pages; the trick is to make the final version of the book follow that guideline and still be visually dynamic to convey the look and feel of the book's theme.
The content of the manual is ready, so the funding will go entirely to paying our talented artists, securing additional artwork, editing, and stretch goal content. We've already gone through the book a few times to rehash and check the content and playability; the final edit will make everything shine and ensure the best quality possible. We have always found the value in paying for professional layout editing so that the book looks as good as possible, and to pay for a proper test print of the physical books to make sure everything looks exactly as we've envisioned. Funds will also go towards final playtesting after stretch goal additions, to ensure the best quality and balance of all the different systems.
The funding goal is average (when compared to similar Kickstarter projects). We're going about this slightly differently from our previous projects because, instead of unlocking tiny stretch goals and slowly building content, we're going to make the book as beautiful and content-heavy as possible from the get-go. The goal is to fill this book with as much world-building as we can and get it out to as many people as possible.
As many of our previous backers know, Deep Dungeon Games is no stranger to Kickstarter campaigns. After nearly 12 successful campaigns and thousands of happy customers, we are confident in our ability to tackle both the creation and production of new products and bring them to fulfillment.
The printing will commence after everyone has had a chance to view the digital version and confirm that the content turned out as expected. Additionally, this will put hundreds of eyes on the copy and layout to help us catch any fixes or errors before committing to printing. This ensures a better overall product.
The cost of shipping will be collected during the survey periods. We hope to keep costs down and will ship EU-friendly to all our friends and backers across the pond.
When the Kickstarter reaches its funding goal, copyediting and layout will start immediately, and fulfilling all rewards will be the highest priority. Additionally, any work for stretch goals will be ongoing during the campaign. Depending on how the Kickstarter turns out we may extend the timeline of the overall project.
The PDFs will be the first item to be sent out as soon as the final layout and editing are complete, plus any other digital content. We have estimated the release of the book in October 2020, but are aware that delays may happen, especially depending on the Stretch Goals that can be unlocked.
 Mid May - Kickstarter launches. 
 Mid June - Kickstarter completes. 
 Early -July - Funds from the Project arrive and are distributed. 
 Mid August - All initial content created for Kickstarter sent for editing and layout. 
 Early -September - Any additional changes, edits, or new art (including unlocked Stretch Goals) will be complete by this time for final editing and layout. 
Early October- Final PDF complete and sent to Backers, and sample prints of Hardcover Books ordered.
 Late October - Books arrive and all shipping completed by end of month. 
Again, this is an estimated timeline and hiccups do happen. We will keep you updated on our progress and any changes through Kickstarter updates. We will also be editing the Kickstarter Page so you can always check the latest status there.
As detailed in the Project Section, all base content in The Mineralogy Manual has already been written, so these Stretch Goals are planned to bring more content into the book.
All backers that pledge $15 or more will benefit from every single stretch goal attained; there are no pledge-specific stretch goals. This is to make sure that everyone, regardless of the amount of their support, can enjoy the same full experience while using the book.  
New Chapter - locked ❌ 
 A new chapter named Organizations of the Earth will be added to The Mineralogy Manual. This introduces three fascinating new guilds who pursue crafting and creation with the primary components included in this book. Your character can join one or more of these guilds and gain certain benefits, advantages, and loyalties due to this joining. Also in this chapter, we will be adding sections like religious organizations, geopolitical organizations, secret organizations, and more!
 The focus of Deep Dungeon Games is to create content focused on availability and world-building for tabletop games. It is extremely challenging to create content for every fantasy tabletop game, but we attempt to hit as many as we can. In addition, authors and other writers will find that a lot of our content can inspire a creative landscape, world, or even characters for their writings, and with everything we create, the hope is that you will be inspired to read, play, and enjoy fantasy.
Hobie Hill - A creator and content writer who has written 10 popular fantasy tabletop supplements and is the driving creative force behind Deep Dungeon Games.
Daniel James - A specialist in dungeon writing, campaigns, and everything in between. Over five years of experience writing campaigns and producing content for tabletop games.
Elizabeth Fowler - A character design specialist with years of creative writing experience. She has many years of experience and adopts individuals from real life to create truly unique characters.
Mark Adams - An elementary teacher who lived abroad in Japan and is a language specialist with a unique ability to adapt the realistic aspects of languages into usable fantasy languages.
Ashten Delgado - A passionate player and creative content writer.
Teresa Guido - A well-known artist in all Deep Dungeon Games projects who attacks every project with enthusiasm and joy.
Deryl Arrazaq - A Concept Artist/Illustrator with years of experience in fantasy illustrations.
Revis A. - A freelance designer for 4 years with clients ranging from local bands to famous pastry makers, with which he developed a vast variety of expertise in different fields of graphic design and illustration.
Onedaygm - A professional graphic designer and a full-time freelance artist with 8+ years of experience.
R. Lee Brown - Editor/Story Doctor for over 30 years who first played ‘that game’ back in the 1980s and has now polished and done graphic layout for several DDG projects.
We are forever grateful for your support and cannot wait to see the new tabletop games, accessories, and content we will create for us all to enjoy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As many of our previous backers know, Deep Dungeon Games is no stranger to Kickstarter campaigns. After nearly 12 successful campaigns and thousands of happy customers, we are confident in our ability to tackle both the creation and production of new products.

However, after the unforeseen circumstances in 2020 that have affected many of us, we have found that we have also been impacted. This has left us without the ability to attend and bring in revenue through conventions and events. While we have not experienced any delays in previous Kickstarter projects, we have had to reassess our situation. As such, this has given us a reason to push projects up on the timeline, however, this does not cause any delays in our current projects. We want to ensure everyone that everything is on schedule, other than the usual minor delays that happen in every project. 

The support of this project not only grants you the ability to access the content, but you are also supporting a small veteran-owned gaming company that is trying to stay busy during these trying times. This will be our last project this year until we have sent out 100% of some of our other existing projects. 

In spite of all this, we are very aware that game development, and the production of creatively intense projects, is an unpredictable process. Complications, changes, and similar struggles are an ever-present reality, and we won’t pretend otherwise. Trouble may still arise as we continue the creation of this unique new supplement. If delays seem likely, we assure you that we will be open, honest, and swift in our communication of these delays to you. If immediate updates are not necessary, we will be sure to communicate any and all progress in our project updates made every other week.

Any stated dates are goals presented as realistically as possible, at the time they are given. Should the project change during the course of its development, dates will change accordingly. We hold very strongly to the principle that quality comes first, and a delayed game is better than a rushed one that is on time. We want you to be satisfied with every product you receive from us and will do what is necessary to ensure the highest quality possible. Should delays or other changes ever prove necessary, we ask for your patience and understanding as you embark on another exciting adventure with us.

For production, we're using a proven manufacturer with amazing turnaround time and great product quality. Their facility will handle everything from the printing, cutting, quality assurance, and shipping directly to our front doorstep.

Our artist has a proven track record of beautiful work and a quick turnaround time; this is the single longest part of our production process. We receive consistently amazing artwork on a daily basis with 1-2 finished art pieces delivered every day. We have already included the estimated 25 days of additional artwork in the project, so we expect no delays as we move forward.

As with our last books, final packaging will be completed directly at the manufacturer; however, final shipping to customers will be going through our hands. We have learned to plan carefully, price as exactly as possible, and remove as much of the time-consuming hands-on process as possible. That's why we'll just be printing labels and shipping pre-boxed decks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 

I hope all is well with everyone, we are currently now waiting on the test print for the final of the book! Also, the digital version is available via download in your backerkit. We ended up only cutting the battlemaps from the book, but we will be sending a PDF file of the maps to everyone. There was really no use for the battlemaps for the book, other than seeing them in the book. Other than that the content is all there for you all to see and admire! Let us know what you think!

Good news! The final edits are complete and the final layout is almost done as well! It has been a long haul but we have been getting there slowly. I am pretty excited with how it all came together, and as soon as I have the final we will begin to set it up for final digital format and for printing!

 UNTIL THEN PLEASE CHECK OUT DANS DUNGEONS FIRST PROJECT!

updates.update_userinfo: April Update - Final Edits and Layout Changes
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! We are almost done, I will be updating in the next week or so! Sorry to keep you all waiting but we are barreling into the writings and are so close to being finished! We have only 2 to 3 pages of final edits to go and then to finish the layout on those last few. They were just a few that we changed at the end and needed to be updated! 

Stay tuned!

Hello everyone, we have finally made it through 2020, and I hope you are all as happy as we are about that! So to all of you wonderful backers, Happy New Year!

So a few things as we wrap up the first full preview:
We are locking addresses and you will be given enough time to make any last-minute changes to your shipping address. Having updated and accurate addresses will save time and reduce shipping costs by preventing returned packages.

Hello all you wonderful backers, I hope this update finds you well after coming off from the holidays. We did take some time to enjoy it as well, but we have still been hard at work. Thank you to all of our loyal backers, those who stayed engaged with the project, and being patient with the progress. I am excited to announce that editing for all of the content in The Mineralogy Manual is officially complete!

Now, all we have remaining to get the first full look of the content is to finish the layout and reviews the elements, minerals, rocks, ley lines, and heroes sections. Our layout expert is handling each section diligently, and working with the tweaks and changes flawlessly.  We currently are at 403 pages that are done with layout and we are anticipating the remaining pages to be around 174 pages. We are pretty excited about the outcome and truly cannot wait to show you the preview pdf in the coming weeks.

Hey everyone, everything is going great thus far! We are through 291 with another 84 pages coming in the next week or so. This is incredible progress, despite us being a little behind schedule, the content for the book is coming along amazingly. if you missed update #26, it had new links and preview content for backers. 

So to give you a bit of the content that is completed and things left to do check out the list below:

Hello everyone, I hope everyone is having a fantastic week! We always love giving back to you all, even if it is in the form of digital content! I personally never might be able to give back to each of, but I am sure going to try.
The end of the year is upon us and that means a ton of holiday shenanigans. This can take the form of good food, friends, family, and hopefully fun. This year has been heavy on us all, and hopefully, you all are able to do the things you want to for the holiday season. Just remember to be safe and remember that we are all in this together. So, this year's chaos has allowed me to get way more focused on the back end of things when in a normal year I would let it slide. This is because I normally do 2 to 3 conventions every month, with mixed results depending on a plethora of things. The greatest loss to me is that I do not get to meet followers, backers, and customers of Deep Dungeon Games.

Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable RONDEL action system and action combo-ing!
Every player's Rondel is unique, every game!
In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.
Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel, selecting which action to perform...
It isn't just other pirates standing in your way of burying treasures! The Royal Navy has their eye on you and the more notorious you become, the more eager they are to stopping your exploits. 
An encounter with the Navy will surely slow your progress, so you best be avoiding them. To do so, you're going to need a good ship and a great crew!
There's a lot of scallywags out there looking for adventure! So assembling your crew won't be very hard, but pulling together a winning crew... that's a different story.
Your crew will play a major role in Tiny Epic Pirates. Each crew member brings different advantages to battle and to the actions you'll take. 
The dice listed at the top of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent what number you'll need to roll to score a hit on another ship! Having multiples of a single number can result in lots of damage, but spreading your numbers out can result in more consistent results. The choice is yours!
The icons listed at the bottom of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent bonus actions that can chain together for epic turns! If the first icon matches your chosen action, you'll get to take the action of the second icon for free.
In addition to your crew, you'll have your reputation and your exploits. As you prove yourself in battle, your legend will grow and so will your ability to command your ship.
Winning battles against other pirates, and against notable merchants, will increase your Legend Level. Each new level offers immediate benefits, as well as increases to your ship's movement and the number of dice you roll in battle.
But enough talk, you're no landlubber. You can learn more about Tiny Epic Pirates by engaging with us in the comments, watching the videos below, or by downloading the rulebook below.

Deluxe Content: Crimson Silver Mini Expansion
The Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!
Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!
Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...
Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!
Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!
If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!
Do you dare to set sail on ghostly waters?
The Curse of Amdiak expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Pirates. It will share the same width and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Curse of Amdiak expansion is available in the 'All-In Deluxe' reward tier or as an add-on in the pledge manager service after the project.

The 6 design goals of a Tiny Epic game!
"Tiny Epic" is an exclusive series of small box games produced by Gamelyn Games and designed by Scott Almes.
Each game in the series is entirely unique but strictly adheres to two core values: TINY and EPIC!
• TINY being the small box used for each game AND the simple, easy to understand, set of rules each possesses.
• EPIC being their surprisingly gratifying gameplay. Each is packed with meaningful decisions, layered strategy, and high replayability, traits not typically found in games this size.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Pirates to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
Rise of the Psycho Rangers:
Created from the power of the Dark Specter, the Psycho Rangers have risen! Designed to be faster, stronger, and smarter than the Power Rangers, each Psycho Ranger was created with the sole purpose of annihilating their Power Ranger counterpart!
With the Astro Megaship as their new command center and a whole new set of Zords to summon, can veterans Andros, Carlos, T.J., Ashley, and Cassie band together to overcome the assault of the terrifying Psycho Rangers?
This expansion also introduces Mastermind Mode, which allows one player to take control of the forces of evil, pitting player against player in a battle of wits!
Machine Empire:
The Royal House of Gadgetry has arrived to conquer Earth! With all of their mechanical might, the Machine King and his coterie prepare for battle. The Power Rangers' skills will be put to the test as they deal with the machinations of this catastrophic clockwork court. 
Meet the Machine Empire! The devious Prince Gasket, the heir to the throne, is joined by the enchanting Princess Archerina, while the egotistical Louie Kaboom plots their downfall. Big Bad General Venjix leads the empire's forces, and King Mondo himself rules with an iron fist and his terrifying Sword of Damocles. 
This expansion introduces the concept of paired monsters. Are you brave enough to face Prince Gasket and Princess Archerina together as a deadly double act?

campaign.story:
Most of the marble runs include the track and the holes on the same molded pieces, limiting your options for how the pieces can be fitted together. With the modular design of MagnetCubes, you can easily connect multiple structures together.
The structure becomes a complex and impressive multi-level design. Build and rebuild whatever you can imagine. You could sit down again and again, with new creations every time.
MagnetCubes is a totally new modular magnetic building set for creating roller coaster themed marble runs and large structures. This intuitive building system is fun for all ages and can be configured in endless ways. 
This toy is a modern take on the simple building blocks and construction sets that we all grow up with. MagnetCubes is great for getting kids curious and interested in STEM concepts by challenging spatial reasoning and understanding of physics principles. 
Sets use open cubes with magnets in each corner that easily snap together without the need for special connectors or any prior experience. Simply unpack and build!   
With 64 cubes and multiple action pieces, the design possibilities are endless. Each set can be added onto the next, allowing you to build big and fantastic marble runs as you imagine!
Great for keeping your mind sharp, limber and most importantly, interested! 
The open design of MagnetCubes makes all the action visible. With the panels included in the AdvancedPack, you can weave marble tracks in and out of the architectural structures. 
This building set is not just for kids. Building MagnetCubes is also a joyful experience for parents and adults. Join in the fun and build with the kids to make more complex designs.  
Watching the kids learn as they played is one of the greatest joys
Keep stacking the modular and magnetic building blocks together. Be amazed at how easily, quickly and massively tall structures can be made without toppling over.It’s more fun to play together, with your friends, family, co-workers...

Great for quick breaks from the screen. Relieve stress by fidgeting with beautiful structures and relaxing kinetic movement. 

MagnetCubes is a building system that inspires children to learn STEM principles. The combination of play, exploration, and iterative testing will help children develop critical thinking skills needed to excel in multiple fields. In no time at all, you will have a creative engineer and designer on your hands.

campaign.story:
What can you expect?
an engaging narrative adventure
multiple storylines in one adventure deck (so every deck can be played multiple times!)
competitive (6 character unique adventure decks) as well as cooperative play (a cooperative adventure deck in the box)
expandable with boosters (new stories with dozens extra combinations of outcomes)
a Kickstarter exclusive cooperative story (available as add-on)
English, Spanish, French, German and Dutch version available (choose your language in the pledge manager)  
For more information, also see the FAQ

Gameplay overview: 
More in depth rules explanation [English and Dutch]:
 Or have a look at the (draft) rulebook here. 
If you want to buy multiple copies, just add the extra amount to the pledge. You'll be able to select the extra copies (and languages) in the pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign.      
*EU 1: UK, Austria, Denmark, Finland, France, Italy, Poland, Sweden
*EU 2: Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Estonia, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourgh, Norway, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Switzerland, Ukraine
*ASIA 1: China, Hong Kong, Macao
*ASIA 2: Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Phillipines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam
If your country is not listed and you want to get a better estimate of the shipping costs, please email us at kickstarter@blackboxadventures.com.
NOTE: The game will be heavy, at about 4 kg / 8 lb. Our goal is to deliver the game in Q1 2021. Note this is an estimation and some things (like COVID-19) might be out of our control. However, we will do our best to deliver the game to you in time!
Group Pledges
Because each game box is so large and heavy, there is little to none savings to be had shipping multiple games to the same location. However, from 10 games we can offer a 10% discount and from 20 games we can offer a 20% discount. Email us for a confirmation and for any questions: kickstarter@blackboxadventures.com. 
Retailer
Retailers should be able to receive the same Kickstarter extras as other backers. That means retailers will also get an extra discount and have the option to get the Deluxe version (not available for retail after the campaign) and the Kickstarter exclusive story. For more information see here. If you're an interested retailer, pledge at the Trader level (€110). This is for the minimum of 2 cases, which is a total of 4 games of the retail version. After the campaign, you will be redirected to a special pledge manager where you can also upgrade your pledge to the Deluxe version and/or order more copies. For any questions send an email to kickstarter@blackboxadventures.com. 
Use these avatars on Kickstarter or social media, so everybody knows about Adventures in Neverland!         
This kickstarter is a collaboration of: 
In addition we would like to thank our awesome side-kick team! We're still astonished by all their enduring, wonderfull support and for making our lives so much easier!
Terms and conditions
The following terms and conditions apply when you pledge to one of our games.
REFUND POLICY The Kickstarter terms allow you to get a full refund if the request is received within 14 days from the end of the campaign. Any request made after this period will be at the discretion of Black Box Adventures and will be a maximum of 90% of the pledge cost (due to Kickstarter and card fees already paid by Black Box Adventures).
RETURNING PRODUCTS If you fail to accept your package when it is delivered we will not issue a refund for the cost of the pledge (and shipping).
DAMAGED PRODUCTS  We guarantee that the packages you receive from us will be complete and include all the items in perfect condition. If not, we will replace any missing or damaged items. Replacements for minor cosmetic damage to external boxes will be decided on a case by case basis.
SURVEY RESPONSE  We will use a pledge manager. You will be required to fill a survey on that platform. We will send out several mails and updates notifying you of the deadline to fill the survey. If you do not fill out the survey by this deadline after notifications have been sent, we may not be able to fulfill your pledge.
REASONABLE CHANGES TO PRODUCT  Due to ongoing testing and developing and potential improvements suggested by the factory, the final product may be different from the prototype shown on this page. By pledging to this project you acknowledge that the final game may be different from that presented in this Kickstarter campaign. Having said this, Black Box Adventures will make every effort to keep the final game as close to the Kickstarter project as possible and only make changes to improve the game. If major changes have to be made, Black Box Adventures wil inform the backers about the changes and the reasons for such changes.
OTHER LANGUAGE EDITIONS  The Spanish and French translation will be handled by 2 Tomatoes. The Dutch translation will be handled by Black Box Adventures. For specific questions or problems concerning the translation copies (also after the campaign) you can contact the responsible company. The other language editions will be available in all countries during the Kickstarter. 
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although every project comes with risks, we've done our best to minimize them. This isn't our first project and we're partnering up with a few other experienced companies. However, we rely on our suppliers just as you rely on us, and hope for a relationship of mutual understanding.

We've worked with different manufacturers in the past and don't work any more with those not living up to our expectations. That's why we choose a new manufacturing partner that has done games for major publishers and creators and who has come recommended with impeccable credentials. 
Some events may be out of our reach. One such event is COVID-19. To take such events into account we've talked with the manufacturer and gave ourselves some more time to deliver the game. We would love to tell you your game will arrive earlier, instead of the other way around...

Shipping is always a risk, especially when shipping international orders. After production is complete, we'll be shipping the game worldwide through several fulfillment centers, ensuring that we have "Friendly Shipping" (no import taxes) to the US, EU, Canada, Australia and New Zealand. We'll also be subsidizing a portion of the shipping cost for all pledges to keep your costs down. Like before, we're using a highly renowned fulfillment partner for an ultra smooth fulfillment process. For more information see terms & conditions above.

The EU has recently implemented stricter tax regulations on online sales in general and crowdfunding in particular. We thus are obliged to collect and pay VAT on the value of the total of the pledge and shipping amount. VAT varies between 17% and 25% with most countries at 20% and above. The total amount is calculated on the amount paid for the game and the shipping. We have taken these costs into account so you will not need to worry about them. It is important to note that VAT is a sales tax that is separate from import taxes or duties. We will cover import duties in the USA, Europe, Canada, Australia and New Zealand so you do not have to worry about those. Other regions might incur import duties.

Adventures in Neverland has been developed over 5 years, with numerous play-testers and groups in different countries. A new batch of test groups will be brought in after the end of the Kickstarter (and COVID-19) to test the final content and to blind test the rulebook.
 
Lastly, although we are working very hard to expand our range of games, we put originality before anything else. Every game we publish must be an original masterpiece, drooling with flavor by itself. We will do everything in our power to achieve this goal. Like our previous games, we will listen to the backers. Together Adventures in Neverland will be a unique game, dedicated to J.M. Barrie's legacy!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of our games are made with longevity in mind. We use high-quality components for all of our pieces. Short of losing pieces (which we typically replace for only shipping costs), our games should last you for decades to come.
Sustainable Distribution
All of our fulfillment and logistics are arranged to limit the number of miles/stops each game travels, by using multiple distribution hubs dispersed on different continents. It's not only better for the world, but it also makes business sense.

updates.update_content:
Just a quick update:
Last week we've received the white sample from our manufacturer. It is used to check all the sizes and quality of the components, as well as to give us an idea what the final product will look like. Although the name suggests it, not everything is white! The wooden tokens are already printed and engraved, and the dice are colored too. The upgraded dice even contain some faerie dust! The engraving on the tokens is very detailed and the dice are pretty big. The box, however, is huge and sturdy, just like we intended (and need, mind you)! Overall we're very happy with nearly everything, despite some minor comments. We'll give this feedback to the manufacturer so they can correct it. Have a look yourself:

Hi everyone,
We've got some updates for you!
Rulebook
Last time we talked about the rulebook undergoing its final editorial check. That's finished now and we're happy to share the final rulebook with you. Of course it's still possible some tiny errors slipped through, so if you find any, or have any other comments, please let us know!

Hi everyone, it's time for a new update. First off, we'd like to show you the starting events you've unlocked as a stretch goal during the campaign. You can choose to play with any number of starting events. The Crocodile adds an extra threat to the board, the Merchant hands out free items, and Night will change the island, making some special locations inaccessible. The Crocodile was already shown in the rulebook, but we'd like to give you a look at the other 2 new events today. First up: the Merchant.

BoardGameGeek 'most anticipated game 2021'
After one week we’ve already received a lot of votes on the BoardGameGeek poll. There’s still time to cast your votes and help Adventures in Neverland reach the top of the list, to become one of the most anticipated games of 2021 on BoardGameGeek! Check out our previous update if you don’t know how to vote or don’t know what we’re talking about here.
Production Update

At the start of this year, nobody would have thought that our way of living would be turned upside down during the course of this year. campaign.story:
Which Product is Right for you?
The Shogun and Wallenstein Big Boxes include rulebooks in English and German. For this campaign only, we are including a printed rulebook in French for backers in French speaking areas. 

Pledging for this Campaign
Shipping is charge during the campaign. To see shipping rates to your country, please click on the pledge level.
Production is planned for Q1 2021, with shipping projected for April.
Products marked as Exclusive will be reserved for direct sales from Queen Games only. After fulfilling the campaign, and as supplies last, remaining items may be sold at conventions, as part of future campaigns, or on our e-commerce portals. They will not receive a general retail release. 
We are using Crowd Ox to help manage our campaigns. After the campaign, you will receive an email to  confirm your shipment details and add-on extra copies of products if you would like. More information will be provided after the campaign closes.  
Shogun Upgrade Kit
3-D Buildings: 3D plastic shrines, temples, and fortresses (previously cardboard tokens).
Armies: Miniature meeples (previously cubes). These have been included in previous Shogun Big Box Kickstarter campaigns, and have been tested to work in the cube tower. Please note we are not able to sell the upgrade kit without them.
Tokens and Revolt Markers: Plastic bits with heat-transferred image (previously wood or cardboard tokens). Please note these are the some tokens that have recently been seen in the very popular Board Game Geek "GeekUp" kits.
Metal Coins: Custom designed metal coins. The design for the coins is still a work in progress, but they will most likely be printed in Europe, and we are striving to have the best quality metal coins we can. 
Wallenstein Upgrade Kit
3-D Buildings: 3D palaces, churches, and trading posts (previously cardboard tokens).
Armies: Miniature meeples (previously cubes).
Coats of Arms: Acrylic with printed image (previously wooden tokens)
Revolt markers: Plastic bits with heat-transferred image (previously wooden tokens). Please note these are the some tokens that have recently been seen in the very popular Board Game Geek "GeekUp" kits.
Bonus Tiles: Acrylic tiles with printed image (previously cardboard tiles).  

Queen Games Cube Tower Games: Hybrid Euro/Conflict Games
Dirk Henn designed Wallenstein in 2002 and it was an instant success with strategy gamers everywhere. The central feature was the Cube Tower which was used for combat resolution. Cubes in a battle are put into the tower, and what comes out eliminates in a 1-to-1 fashion until only one army is left. Some of your cubes might get stuck in the tower, but don't worry, they will come out later and provide you an unexpected advantage. The cube tower draws a middle line between deterministic and dice based combat, allowing for randomness in battles (for excitement), but more even odds across the course of the game. Plus, it is a lot of fun to dump a handful of cubes into the tower!
The Cube Tower games pairs this mechanism with area majority scoring for buildings which are built around the map and pre-programmed turns. There are 10 actions each year, and at the start of a year the order of these actions are shuffled and the first 5 revealed. You will need to choose which provinces that you control will perform  the various actions, such as launching attacks or taxing, from the start, much like a commander planning an upcoming campaign. The blend of Euro mechanics with an area-majority conflict game makes Shogun and Wallenstein unique hybrids between Euro games and conflict games. 

Wallenstein was followed by Shogun which a new theme, new mechanics, and a new map that challenged players in different ways.
For More Info, click on the picture or the links below, or scroll to the bottom of the page. 
  Game Rules in Various Languages
Games Rules in Various Languages 
Wallenstein
The goal of the game is to earn points by controlling counties which have the three different buildings on them. At the end of the year, whomever own the most of each building type in the different regions of the map will receive the most points (with second and third place scoring as well). In addition to building infrastructure to score points, you must also feed your peasants or they will revolt. Revolting peasants can lose you armies and possibly the county. 
Shogun
In Shogun, each player assumes the role of a great Daimyo with all his troops. Each Daimyo has the same 10 possible actions to develop his empire and secure points. Castles, temples, and theaters replace the infrastructure of Wallenstein (as rice replaces wheat), creating a thematic experience for players who wish to move their exploits east to the Land of the Rising Sun.
Production and Delivery

                     Production for both the upgraded components and Big Boxes is planned for Q1 of 2021. We plan on producing all items, including the metal coins, in Europe to help ensure high quality and a fast turnaround between product and fulfillment. There is typically only a short delay between the end of production and when we can start the fulfillment process. 
Pledges to the US will most likely be sent via container to a fulfillment center. Please note that all shipping projections are our best estimates only, and not guarantees.
We offer "friendly" shipping to a number of zones around the world, including the United States, Canada, the UK, the European Union, and Australia/New Zealand. If your country is not listed as "friendly," Queen Games is not responsible for any local charges, customs fees, or if a local carrier (i.e. not the carrier we shipped by) loses your package. In these cases, we are not able to reimburse you for any charges.
Queen Games assumes responsibility for shipping your pledge to the address provided in the pledge manager and guaranteeing delivery either to that address via our original carrier, or its transfer to your local post service. If the package is successfully delivered to the correct address, or handed over to your local post service, our obligation will be considered complete, and we may not be able to provide a replacement if the package is not picked up or is lost by the local post. Failure to complete the survey by the fulfillment date could also result in a non-delivery of the product.
Post Campaign Communication

     We will monitor the comment section and messages while the campaign is active in order to answer everyone's questions. Please note that, since we do not have a full time employee dedicated to Kickstarter alone, we may not be able to actively monitor the comments after the campaign closes. If you have a question about your pledge, please send us a message.
We will do our best to post all pertinent information in a timely manner either as an update or in emails to relevant backers.
 Terms and Conditions 
By pledging for this product, you are accepting the following terms.
REFUND POLICY Following the terms of Kickstarter, Queen Games will provide a full refund provided the request is received within 14 days of the close of the campaign.If a request is made after this period, any refund would be at the discretion of Queen Games, and would be a maximum of 85% based on incurred fees and handling costs.
DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.
RETURNED PRODUCTS If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.
FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.
REASONABLE CHANGES TO PRODUCT By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the name, final look, and materials of the project are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter campaign was active. Queen Games will make all reasonable efforts to make the final product congruent with what is presented in the campaign, and to inform backers of the reasons for necessary changes.

updates.update_content:
We are sad to report that we must announce a fairly major delay to this project. 

As you may know if you back our projects, we typically manufacture our games in the EU. However, the Deluxe upgrade kits had a number of components which did not make this feasible, and so our plan was to produce these items in China. As you are probably aware if you back other Kickstarter campaigns, due to the last year of the pandemic, manufacturing out of China is backed up quite a bit right now. We had thought it might be possible to get close to our original April fulfillment date, but recently it became clear that manufacturing was going to be delayed. In addition, our manufacturing date for the new Big Boxes in the EU was also bumped.

We hope everyone is having a good start to 2021 (all things considered). In this update we don't have any graphics to share, but we do have some information on how the project is progressing.

 Overall, while the design for the Deluxe components is progressing, several of the pieces are types that we have never produced before, and will require us to produce them at new factories. We typically manufacture our components in the EU, which we feel offers us the highest quality and simplified logistics (not to mention the opportunity to support our local and adjacent economies). After the various types of components are produced they are transported to a single facility, compiled into the final product, and sent to our logistics partner in the Netherlands or our HQ in Germany for distribution. However, several of the parts for this product are types we have never made before, and we have determined that we will need to manufacture these specific parts in Asia.  We suspect that there will be a delay of 1-2 months, due to the increased time it is taking right now to manufacture and transport from Asia to Europe where our games will be packed.

If you need to make any changes to your address or check on your pledge, you can do so here. We do not have a date set for closing the pledge manager, but it will most likely be not until early 2021.

Thanks everyone for helping make this a great campaign. Shortly we will open the pledge manager, at which point you may add on any extras you would like and finalize your shipping details. We will post an update when it is live, and you will also get an email from Crowd Ox.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Canvas will be printed on high quality, durable components. The sleeves that come with the game are not only essential for gameplay, they also help increase the lifespan of the cards. Canvas was designed with future add-ons and expansions in mind. The art style and graphic design can handle different illustration and themes so that we can create future expansions that don't require reprinting all of the base game components.
Reusability and recyclability
Our manufacturer, PandaGM, will be producing replacement components so that damaged or missing pieces can be replaced with a small shipment instead of a second copy of the game, saving gas and materials. Canvas components are stored in reusable storage bags. The box efficiently holds all game pieces and add-ons without wasted space from a plastic insert.
Sustainable materials
The box and punchboard are made from 30% recycled materials for the ideal blend of durability and sustainability. The cards are made with materials from FSC certified sources. Components are printed with eco-friendly water-based ink and varnish. Our premium components are made from wood instead of plastic. The packing cartons are 100% recycled paper pulp.
Environmentally friendly factories
PandaGM recycles all plastic and paper waste. The factory is fully air-conditioned for worker comfort and has passed ISO worker health and safety standards, is BSCI social compliance certified, and follows the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety. Their project management and customer service teams all work remotely, which has a major impact on their carbon footprint.

updates.update_content:
Canvas: Reflections is LIVE on Kickstarter
Hello again! We hope you've all been enjoying Canvas. If you'd like to join us on another Kickstarter adventure, head on over to the recently launched Canvas: Reflections page. The campaign funded in just 24 minutes and already over 6,000 backers have joined in!

Campaign Wrap-Up
With UK shipping underway, fulfillment is nearing the end! 52,145 rewards have now been shipped to backers all over the world. We owe a big thank you to our manufacturer, Panda Games Manufacturing, and our distributors Funagain, Surfin' Meeple, Aetherworks, and Zatu for overcoming challenges brought on by COVID and Brexit and bringing this project across the finish line. And thanks to all you backers for going on this journey with us. Your support and generosity are what allows Andrew and I to keep our dream jobs, and we are forever grateful for that.

We have some great news for UK backers!
We just received word that the freight shipment arrived today in the UK and will be at Zatu Fulfillment's warehouse on Monday. There are several projects in queue with this shipment, but they are going to ship Canvas first! Zatu will get to work picking, packing, and mailing out nearly 5,000 rewards. All orders are expected to be shipped out by the end of next week. Jeff and I want to thank everyone again for their patience as we, the freight forwarders, fulfillment team, and Zatu navigated this post-Brexit process.

Just a quick update for our UK backers:
Surfin Meeple just confirmed that the mountain of paperwork has been completed by both the fulfillment center and the UK customs office. The pick-up request has been submitted and the fulfillment center is just waiting on the go ahead from the UK customs office to ship everything to Zatu this week. Andrew and I know this UK delivery process has been frustratingly slow as the involved parties are still figuring out how to navigate through all this new legislation. We'll keep pushing for updates from the fulfillment center and post the next UK shipping update the moment we receive news. Hopefully we'll get a freight shipment and delivery timeline in the coming weeks.

Fulfillment Progress
EU: The EU fulfillment center has at least one more week of shipping games out the door. So, if you still don't have your tracking information or if you have not received your order, please allow at least another couple weeks while the games are in transit. 
UK: We received the following email from the distributor:"The EU depot continues working on transferring stock to Zatu for UK order fulfillment. This is a new process that they're still learning as they go, and it's unclear right now when they'll be able to send the transfer shipment, as there seems to be some sort of pending documentation approval on the Great Britain side of things. I'm trying to get more information on what this process actually looks like, but so far haven't been able to get much clarity. I'm continuing to push on it so I can hopefully give more informative updates."

Andrew and I are so happy to see that many of you have received your copies of Canvas! It's so cool to see all the community engagement, from the interpretive painting analyses on Instagram, to the solo challenges on Board Game Geek. One of my favorite posts was by @tabletoptale featuring an alternate setup using the easels to display the Scoring Cards, which I've recreated below in case anyone wants to try it.

It's happening! The fulfillment centers are working as fast as they can to pick, pack, and label your orders. Be aware that not everyone will receive their orders at the same time due to COVID safety precautions in place and over 50,000 rewards needing to be packed & shipped. We appreciate your patience as the fulfillment process is ongoing.
Shipping Timelines

Last Minute Address Changes
Wednesday, January 6th is the last possible day to change your shipping address. If you need to update it, email your new address to help@funagainlogistics.com.
Freight Shipping Update

Hello backers! We have some news to share about shipping.
But first, just a reminder that the below timelines are still estimations. We could wait until we receive firm dates, but then backers would feel left in the dark for a long period of time. Instead, we decided to give you all the information we have including our best guesses for delivery times. The ETA's are subject to change especially with the unpredictability of shipping during a holiday season with COVID protocols. So with that in mind, please set your expectations accordingly.
  Timelines

Bon Voyage! Canvas has set sail!
The pallets of games have been split into separate shipments and sent to each of our regional distributors. The delivery time for each region depends on the distance from the manufacturer in China. So from this point on, fulfillment progress will vary by location.
For North American Backers: The games are being loaded onto a boat called ATHOS, which will begin its long journey across the Pacific Ocean on November 18th. The ship should arrive at port on December 12. Then, the games will travel by truck to the distribution center, Funagain Logistics, in Indianapolis. Shipping to your house will likely begin in late-December.

After three years, Cephalofair Games is back and better than ever. Isaac ran all previous Kickstarters by himself, but now Cephalofair Games has a team, and that team is ready to make sure everything goes according to plan.

We've still got a long road ahead to fully finish the game. Our plan is to get the files to the printer in October, which should give us plenty of time to print everything and get your games shipped to you by early next year. No doubt there will be complications along the way — there always are — but we feel well-equipped to handle them. We have great confidence in our manufacturer, freight shippers, and fulfillment centers to get the job done right.

Of course, we would be remiss if we didn't talk about that elephant over there — COVID-19. This pandemic could have effects on every leg of our journey, from manufacturing to freight shipping to fulfillment. Luckily, it won't have much of an effect on the development of the game, and we won't be moving onto those other steps until the fall. updates.update_content:
Hello! Another two weeks have passed, and I am once again here to regale you with tales of Frosthaven! We're continuing to make progress on getting all the files ready, but I thought I'd take the opportunity today to let Greg Spence from Broken Token give you an update on where they're at with the Frosthaven wooden organizer.
So here's Greg! If you didn't order the organizer, there's some more update info below.
---

Hello! Wow, it has been a flurry of activity over here trying to get stuff finalized, and I am tired! Gotta keep trucking, though, because that finish line is getting close.
Because of how inter-connected everything is in the game, and how many different elements there are, sometimes it feels like you're doing so much, but you don't have a lot to show for it, because you're working on those connections and making sure everything is in place. It's like we're setting up an intricate domino line, so that when we're ready, we can just knock that first one over and complete everything, one after the other.
Other times, though, you do get to knock over some of those dominoes, and it feels great, because you finally have ! Today, thankfully, is a day like that, because I get to show you the final versions (barring minor tweaks I'll talk about in a minute) of the and !

updates.update_userinfo: Where we are with the project and a focus on perks
updates.update_content: Hello! It is Friday, and I am coming at you with the same enthusiasm as always, excited to tell you about everything going on over here. So look, I'm not going to pretend like last update didn't create a bit of a stir, but there is a lot to talk about, so I'm not going to dwell on it too heavily. It seems there were some misconceptions about what the cultural consulting process entails, and, as that is not what this update is about, I would simply direct you again to these in-depth explanations if you have any questions, and a lot of the arguments and counter arguments are also explored in an interview I did with Shelf Stories since the update.

Hello! Today we're going to get right into a discussion of some news I'm really excited about. I didn't want to spend too much time talking about other stuff, but rest assured that progress is still being made on all fronts of finishing up this project, and I'll have more updates on all of that next time.
For now, I want to talk about some developments that are really going to improve the overall narrative of the game. It's a bit of a long discussion, so if you find yourself not reading all the way through, at the very least, make sure that you read the last section (starting with “And finally”).

Hello! I hope you are doing wonderfully today! Things continue to progress over here. Everything is getting done, little by little.
It's funny, when I look back at the last two weeks to take an inventory of what's been done, it's just a thousand little things all over the place. This project is so huge, even just tackling all the small stuff can end up taking a long time. We're mostly down to the small stuff, but there is an immense amount of that small stuff.

updates.update_userinfo: Frosthaven pins, plus finishing up the narrative

Hello! I am excited this week, because I am finally through getting all the narrative text written for the side scenarios. Yay!

There is not a whole lot talk about this week. We're continuing to make progress on all the various fronts of this massive endeavor. Also lots of progress on the graphic design front with various cards and books. It's all kind of coming together!

Hello! I hope you are doing well! Things are moving along over here. We just recently started play testing the campaign aspects of the game (players play through the entire campaign by sort of hand-waving the actual scenario parts of it with some simple metrics), and that is proving very helpful in refining some of the overall systems of the game, which is great.
